A city with more than one religion can have religious buildings for each religion: for example, a city with Judaism and Confucianism could construct both a Jewish Temple and a Confucian Temple.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Temples[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]The most primitive religious building. Temples boost a city's [LINK=CONCEPT_CULTURE]Culture[\LINK] and [LINK=CONCEPT_HAPPINESS]Happiness[\LINK]. They allow 1 population point to be turned into a priest [LINK=CONCEPT_SPECIALISTS]Specialist[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Monasteries[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Monasteries increase a city's research by a small amount. More importantly, they allow the city to build missionaries to spread your religion.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Cathedrals[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Cathedrals drastically increase a city's culture. They increase happiness if their religion is the civilization's state religion. They allow two population points to be turned into priests. Note that "Cathedral" is a generic name for a religion's grander houses of worship - Jewish synagogues, Islamic mosques, Christian cathedrals, etc., all have the same effects. Your civilization can only build one cathedral for every three temples that your civilization possesses; for example, a civilization with seven temples could build two cathedrals. [PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Shrines[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Shrines can be built only in cities in which a religion has been founded. Shrines are constructed by [LINK=CONCEPT_GREAT_PEOPLE]Great Prophets[\LINK]; a great prophet is the only unit that can build a shrine, and the prophet is consumed in the process. Shrines increase the spread of the religion, as well as the home city's culture. They increase the city's chance of generating prophets and allow the city to assign three population as priests. Most importantly, shrines generate one gold each turn for every city on the map that has the shrine's religion (thus explaining the importance of creating missionaries to spread the word). Each religion has a different name for its cathedral and shrine.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]宗教信仰[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]宗教信仰在人类历史上经常占据着重要的角色。通过宗教，人类寻求对宇宙的理解，确定自己存在的意义。宗教使人得到灵感和启迪，使人变得高贵和自尊；人们以宗教的名义修建宏伟的殿宇，撰写智慧的典籍，谱写美丽的乐章。人们也以宗教的名义屠杀和奴役着他们的兄弟姊妹。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]游戏中的宗教信仰[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]我们知道人们对于宗教信仰有非常强烈的观点和立场——事实上，信仰之间的冲突曾经导致了无数的战争。游戏的开发者无意冒犯任何人的信仰。但是，考虑到宗教信仰在人类文明发展中的重要作用，我们不能将这一重要元素排除在游戏之外；而且尽最大努力，以尊重，公正与中立的态度处理宗教元素。事实上，游戏中所有宗教的作用都是相同的，唯一不同的只是其创立的前提。[PARAGRAPH:2]在文明IV中有七种宗教信仰（经测试采用这个数量可以获得最佳的游戏性）。在具体选择时，我们采用了我们认为公众最为熟悉的几种宗教。我们并不认为这几种宗教比其他信仰更好或是更重要。[PARAGRAPH:2]我们并不对各种宗教进行价值判断；我们尊重任何人的任何信仰。我们是游戏设计师，不是神学家。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]创立宗教[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]如果你率先发现与特定宗教相关联的科技，该宗教将在你的某一城市中创立。拥有一座宗教创始城市有非常多的好处；这将允许大预言家在该城市中建立一座“圣坛”（见下文）。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]官方信仰[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]如果你的城市中存在一种或几种宗教信仰，你可以选择其中一种作为“官方”信仰（国教）。设立官方信仰可使信仰该宗教的城市快乐度更高，生产能力更强；还可以提升宗教建筑和宗教制度类内政法令的作用。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]传播宗教信仰[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]宗教信仰会在城市间随机传播。宗教会传播到邻近的城市，或是有商路相连的城市。某些宗教建筑（见下文）可以提升相应宗教的传播速度，文明所实行的内政法令（见下文）也对宗教的传播具有重要作用。[LINK=UNIT_BUDDHIST_MISSIONARY]传教士[\LINK]使你可以主动进行传教；相关详情见下节。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]传教士[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]一个文明可以组建专门的“传教士”单位以传播其官方信仰。每个文明在同一时刻保有的传教士数量有一定限制，每个传教士单位每回合的维持费为两个金币。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]训练传教士[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]实行[LINK=CIVIC_ORGANIZED_RELIGION]信仰控制[\LINK]内政法令的文明可以在任何信仰国教的城市训练传教士；对于不采用信仰控制政策的文明，则只能在建有修道院的城市训练传教士。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]移动传教士[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]一旦训练完成，传教士可以象其他单位一样在地图上移动。你的传教士可以在本国领土或中立领土中自由通行；但不能进入其他文明的领地，除非签有[LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]开放边界[\LINK]条约。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]传教士如何传播宗教信仰[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]在传教士到达目标城市后，点击传教士单位命令清单中的“传播信仰”命令（见[LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]单位[\LINK]）；如果传播成功，则传教士的宗教将传入该城市。在本国城市传播信仰更容易取得成功。此外，在原来没有信仰的城市传播信仰也比较容易；每增加一种现存信仰，都会进一步降低传教的成功几率。一座城市存在宗教的数量没有限制；七种宗教可能在同一城市并存。传教士在执行任务后将消失，无论成功与否。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]宗教信仰的益处[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]对城市的益处[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]信仰国教的城市可额外增加一个单位的快乐值，并每回合产生一个单位的文化值。因此传播你的官方信仰是游戏早期扩展文化边界的好办法。官方信仰的圣城每回合还能产生五单位文化值，使其能够快速扩展文化边界。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]建筑[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]城市如不存在宗教，将无法建造宗教建筑，例如寺庙和大教堂（见下文）。不存在宗教的城市也不能供养神学家类的[LINK=CONCEPT_SPECIALISTS]专业人员[\LINK]。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]间谍[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]如果你拥有某一宗教的圣城，你的视野将扩展到所有信仰该宗教的外国城市。使你可以免费查探敌方城市的情况。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]圣坛收入[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]如果你拥有某一宗教的圣城，并且产生了一位大预言家，你将可以建造该宗教的圣坛，使全世界所有信仰该宗教的城市都会为你带来收入（见下文）。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]宗教制度类内政法令[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]宗教制度类的[LINK=CONCEPT_CIVICS]内政法令[\LINK]可调整宗教对文明的影响。游戏中共有五种宗教制度。在游戏开始时只有原始信仰；其他宗教制度将在你掌握相应科技后启用。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]原始信仰:[\BOLD]无科技前提。基本的宗教制度。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]信仰控制:[\BOLD]需要[LINK=TECH_MONOTHEISM]一神论[\LINK]。提升信仰国教城市的建造建筑的能力，允许你训练传教士而无须建造修道院。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]神权政治:[\BOLD]需要[LINK=TECH_THEOLOGY]神学[\LINK]。实行神权政治法令，将使信仰国教的城市所组建的单位拥有两点初始经验，并禁止非官方信仰在本国的传播。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]和平主义:[\BOLD]需要[LINK=TECH_PHILOSOPHY]哲学[\LINK]。大大提升信仰国教城市的[LINK=CONCEPT_GREAT_PEOPLE]历史伟人[\LINK]出现几率，并增加军事单位的维持费。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]信仰自由:[\BOLD]需要[LINK=TECH_LIBERALISM]自由主义[\LINK]。实行信仰自由的文明没有官方信仰。任何宗教都可提升城市的快乐度；并且所有城市额外获得10%%的[LINK=CONCEPT_RESEARCH]科研[\LINK]加成。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]宗教建筑[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]可建造的宗教建筑有多种类型。不同宗教有相应的宗教建筑，城市必须信仰特定宗教才能建造相应宗教建筑。信仰多种宗教的城市可以建造多种宗教建筑：例如，同时信仰犹太教和儒学的城市即可同时建造犹太礼拜堂和儒学馆。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]寺庙[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]寺庙是最基本的宗教建筑。寺庙可促进城市的[LINK=CONCEPT_CULTURE]文化[\LINK]和[LINK=CONCEPT_HAPPINESS]快乐[\LINK]。允许1单位人口转化为神学家类[LINK=CONCEPT_SPECIALISTS]专业人员[\LINK]。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]修道院[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]修道院可少量提升城市的科研能力。更重要的是使城市可以训练传教士，以传播你的信仰。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]大教堂[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]大教堂可大大提升城市的文化等级。如所属宗教为官方信仰还将提升城市快乐度。并允许2单位人口转化为神学家。注意“大教堂”泛指任何宗教的大型活动场所——犹太教会堂，伊斯兰清真寺，基督教大教堂等等，其作用完全相同。建造一座大教堂的前提是已建有三座寺庙；例如，建有七座寺庙的文明将可建造两座大教堂。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]圣坛[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]圣坛只能建在创立宗教的城市。圣坛由[LINK=CONCEPT_GREAT_PEOPLE]大预言家[\LINK]建造；大预言家是唯一能建造圣坛的单位，建造圣坛的代价是这位大预言家的消失。圣坛可提升相应宗教的传播速度，以及所在城市的文化等级。并能提升城市产生大预言家的几率，使城市可能供养三位神学家。更重要的是，圣坛能使全世界所有信仰相应宗教的城市为你的文明带来每座城市每回合一个金币的收入（因此训练传教士传播信仰是非常重要的）。每种宗教都有不同名称的大教堂和圣坛类建筑。

TEXT.English: [H1]Research[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]To survive, your civilization must advance and grow technologically. Being backwards is suicide; advanced civilizations have huge advantages in expansion, growth, commerce, production, and, of course, in military units available to them. Your army may outnumber mine by ten to one, but if your army consists of archers and spearmen and mine of musketmen and macemen, you are going to get your butt seriously kicked. A small technological edge is powerful, while a large one is killer. (See [LINK=CONCEPT_TECHNOLOGY]Technology[\LINK] for more information on this important subject.)[PARAGRAPH:2]Each turn your civilization generates "research points" which go toward acquiring new technologies. The more research points generated, the faster your civilization will learn new technologies.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Generating Research Points[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]The number of "research points" that you create each turn is determined by the amount of [LINK=CONCEPT_COMMERCE]Commerce[\LINK] the laborers in your cities generate. As your cities work the land around them, they earn food, production, and commerce. You use the "research button" to determine how much of that commerce you want to turn into research and how much you want in gold (see following). Only commerce generated by your cities can be turned into research: monies you earn from trading, pillaging and looting, merchant activities, and so forth are not available for this purpose.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]The Research Button[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]The research button on the game's main screen displays the current percentage of your commerce you are dedicating to research. At game start it is set at 100%%; you can change this at any time. [PARAGRAPH:2]If your treasury is running low and your current research percentage would cost more commerce than you can spend, the game automatically lowers your research percentage to the highest percentage that you can afford. (You can manually adjust it even lower, of course.) Note that the game does not ever INCREASE your research percentage; any increases must be made manually by you.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Increasing Research Points[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]To get the maximum possible research points, first turn your research percentage up as far as it will go without bankrupting yourself. After that, there are a number of other things you can do. These include:[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Construct Libraries and Other Buildings[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2][LINK=CONCEPT_BUILDINGS]Buildings[\LINK] such as [LINK=BUILDING_LIBRARY]Libraries[\LINK] and Monasteries will increase a city's research.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Assign Scientist Specialists[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Change some of your city's populace into [LINK=CONCEPT_SPECIALISTS]Scientist Specialists[\LINK]. [LINK=CONCEPT_WONDERS]Wonders[\LINK] such as the [LINK=BUILDING_GREAT_LIBRARY]Great Library[\LINK] allow you to change more of your populace into scientists.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Civics[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2][LINK=CONCEPT_CIVICS]Civics[\LINK] like [LINK=CIVIC_FREE_RELIGION]Free Religion[\LINK] and [LINK=CIVIC_REPRESENTATION]Representation[\LINK] increase your civilization's research.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Increase Commerce[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Another way to speed up research is to increase the amount of commerce that your cities are generating. Building [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_COTTAGE]Cottages[\LINK] with workers, settling more cities on the coast, and signing [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Open Borders[\LINK] agreements with other civilizations will all generate more commerce in your cities.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Increase Wealth[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Ironically, you can also increase the amount of research your civ is producing by generating more gold. Building [LINK=BUILDING_MARKETPLACE]Markets[\LINK] and [LINK=BUILDING_BANK]Banks[\LINK] will increase the amount of gold your civ is producing, which will usually allow you to increase the research button (see above) and thus generate more overall research! See the [LINK=CONCEPT_WEALTH]Wealth[\LINK] entry for more information on generating gold.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Expending Research Points[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]All research points are used to acquire [LINK=CONCEPT_TECHNOLOGY]Technology[\LINK]. See that subject for more information.[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]科学研究[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]为了生存和发展，你的文明必须在科技方面保持不断进步。科技落后等于自杀；科技先进的文明将在所有方面体现出优势：拓展领土，增加人口，扩大贸易，促进生产，当然还有更强大的军事力量。质量低劣的军队面对装备先进的军队，即使拥有十比一的数量优势，也一样要被动挨打。拥有小幅技术优势即可体现威力，拥有大幅技术优势则将所向无敌。（关于科技的详情见[LINK=CONCEPT_TECHNOLOGY]科技[\LINK]一节.）[PARAGRAPH:2]你的文明每个回合将产生一些用以获取科技的“研究点数”。产生研究点数越多，获取新科技的速度越快。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]产生研究点数[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]每回合产生“研究点数”的数量受你的城市创造的[LINK=CONCEPT_COMMERCE]商业收入[\LINK]总量影响。城市周围有居民工作的区域将积累食物，工业和商业产出。你可使用“科研按钮”调整每回合商业收入用于科研和存入国库的数量之比（见下文）。只有城市所产生的商业收入才能用于科技研究：来自贸易事业和军事劫掠的金钱不在此列。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]科研按钮[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]游戏主界面的科研按钮显示投入科技研究的商业收入的比率。在游戏开始时设为100%%；你可在任何时候改变比率。[PARAGRAPH:2]如果你的国库储备下降，商业收入不足以满足高比例科研经费，电脑会在尽可能高的前提下自动调整比率。（当然你也可以手动调节到更低水平.）注意电脑绝对不会自动调高科研经费比率；你必须手动调高。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]增加研究点数[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]要尽可能多地增加研究点数，首先应当在不至破产的前提下尽可能地调高科研经费比率。此外，还有其他一些办法。包括:[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]建造图书馆等建筑[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]某些[LINK=CONCEPT_BUILDINGS]建筑[\LINK]例如[LINK=BUILDING_LIBRARY]图书馆[\LINK]和修道院可提升城市科研能力。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]供养科学家[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]将部分城市人口中国转化为科学家类型的[LINK=CONCEPT_SPECIALISTS]专业人员[\LINK]。某些[LINK=CONCEPT_WONDERS]奇观[\LINK]例如[LINK=BUILDING_GREAT_LIBRARY]大图书馆[\LINK]允许你在城市中安置更多的科学家。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]内政法令[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]某些[LINK=CONCEPT_CIVICS]内政法令[\LINK]例如[LINK=CIVIC_FREE_RELIGION]信仰自由[\LINK]和[LINK=CIVIC_REPRESENTATION]代议制度[\LINK]可提升整个文明的科研能力。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]增加商业收入[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]加快科研的另一个办法就是增加商业收入总额。让工人修建[LINK=IMPROVEMENT_COTTAGE]农舍[\LINK]，在海滨建立城市，并与其他文明签订[LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]开放边界[\LINK]条约将可带来更多商业收入。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]增加财富[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]你可以通过赚取更多的金钱提升科研能力。建造[LINK=BUILDING_MARKETPLACE]市场[\LINK]和[LINK=BUILDING_BANK]银行[\LINK]将进一步增加金钱收入，使你能进一步调整科研按钮（见上文），然后产生更多的研究点数！有关获取金钱收入的详情见[LINK=CONCEPT_WEALTH]财富[\LINK]一节。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]消耗研究点数[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]消耗研究点数以获取[LINK=CONCEPT_TECHNOLOGY]科技[\LINK]。详情见相关小节。[PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: [H1]Resistance[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]After you capture a [LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]City[\LINK], it may be a while before its citizens recognize their good fortune in having gained such a wise and benevolent leader as yourself. In the meantime, they may "resist" your rule. Further, cities under great cultural pressure may go into resistance before revolting and "flipping" to another civilization's control (see [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Borders[\LINK]).[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Effects of Resistance[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]No Production, Commerce or Food:[\BOLD] If a city is in resistance, its population refuses to work. Thus the city produces no food, production, or commerce for the duration of the resistance. This may lead to [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Starvation[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]No Cultural Radius:[\BOLD] The city has no [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Cultural Radius[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]No Defensive Bonus:[\BOLD] The city receives no defensive bonus for size or culture (see [LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]Cities[\LINK]).[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Duration of Resistance[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]The duration of a city's resistance is based upon its similarity or dissimilarity to your civilization. If you recapture one of your own cities shortly after it was taken from you, you'll see little or no resistance. A foreign city that has been under a lot of cultural pressure from your civilization will tend to spend less time in resistance, as will a city that shares your civilization's religion. A big, old foreign city with a lot of culture and a different religion will tend to resist longer.[PARAGRAPH:2]You cannot do much to shorten the duration of resistance once it is in progress. However you can lessen the chances of the city returning to resistance by passing your state religion to that city and building temples and such, and by raising the city's culture and reducing any outside cultural pressure on that city. It is also a good idea to have one or two units garrisoning a city in resistance.[PARAGRAPH:2]A [LINK=CONCEPT_GREAT_PEOPLE]Great Artist[\LINK] can instantly end resistance in a city by creating a Great Work in it - but be warned that this will consume the Artist.[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]抵抗[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]当你夺取一座[LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]城市[\LINK]，当地居民可能需要一段时间的体会，才能知道拥有你这样一位智慧贤明的统治者是多么的幸运。在此之前，他们可能会“抵抗”你的统治。此外，处于其他强势文化影响之下的城市也可能出现抵抗，暴乱甚至“叛逃”到其他文明（详情见[LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]国界[\LINK]）。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]抵抗的影响[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]没有工业，商业和食物产出:[\BOLD]处于抵抗状态的城市居民会拒绝工作。因此城市在此其间将没有食物，工业和商业产出。这可能会导致[LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]饥荒[\LINK]。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]没有文化影响范围:[\BOLD]城市将没有[LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]文化影响范围[\LINK]。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]没有防御奖励加成:[\BOLD]城市将不能获得规模和文化等级带来的防御奖励（见[LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]城市[\LINK]）。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]抵抗持续时间[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]城市的抵抗持续时间受双方文明相似程度影响。如果你在短期内收复一座原本就属于你的城市，可能完全没有抵抗活动。取得处于你方文化长期影响之下，或是与你信仰相同的异国城市，抵抗持续时间也会较短。规模庞大，历史久远，文化等级高，宗教差异大的异国城市的抵抗持续时间将会很长。[PARAGRAPH:2]减少抵抗持续时间的办法不多。你可以向占领的城市传播你的官方信仰，建造相应宗教建筑，提升城市本身的文化等级并减少外来文化的影响。在城市保留一个或两个防御单位也是个好主意。[PARAGRAPH:2]一位[LINK=CONCEPT_GREAT_PEOPLE]大艺术家[\LINK]可以通过完成一件艺术杰作，立即结束城市的抵抗状态——但注意这将会使这位大艺术家消失。[PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: [H1]Resources[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]The world of Civilization IV contain various "natural resources" that have benefits for the civilizations which possess them. Some provide military benefits - the "horse" resource allows the creation of mounted units such as the [LINK=UNIT_CHARIOT]Chariot[\LINK] early on and [LINK=UNIT_CAVALRY]Cavalry[\LINK] in the Renaissance period. Some provide productivity benefits - marble decreases the labor required to construct the [LINK=BUILDING_PARTHENON]Parthenon[\LINK] wonder, for example. Other resources provide health and happiness to your cities, allowing them to grow to larger sizes and increase in power. A civilization that possesses a variety of resources will have a distinct advantage over one that possesses few or no resources, and resources are one of the most important factors to keep in mind when choosing city sites with settlers.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Discovering Resources[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Some resources - rice, gold, etc. - begin the game visible. You will be able to see these resources as soon as their space is visible (see [LINK=CONCEPT_EXPLORATION]Exploration[\LINK]). Other resources are hidden at the start of play: they are not uncovered until you have acquired specific [LINK=CONCEPT_TECHNOLOGY]Technologies[\LINK]. Copper is a good example of such a hidden resource; at game start no copper is visible anywhere on the map, but once you acquire the [LINK=TECH_BRONZE_WORKING]Bronze Working[\LINK] technology, copper is revealed.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Resource Locations[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Resources must be within your civilization's [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Cultural Borders[\LINK] in order to be connected to your [LINK=CONCEPT_CITY_NETWORK]City Network[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Working Resources[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]In addition to resources' special abilities, they also usually provide some kind of food, commerce, or production bonus to their space. For example, a wheat resource adds a significant amount of food to the tile on which it is located. If a resource space is within a city radius, that city's laborers can work that space like any other - and they will almost certainly want to, since resources are usually highly desirable tiles.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Resources and Improvements[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Resources require that "improvements" be made to their spaces before you can access their special bonuses (see [LINK=CONCEPT_IMPROVEMENTS]Improvements[\LINK] for more details). Improvements are constructed by [LINK=UNIT_WORKER]Workers[\LINK] (except for water resources, which are improved by [LINK=UNIT_WORKBOAT]Work Boats[\LINK]). If an improvement is pillaged or otherwise destroyed, you lose the resource's benefits until the improvement is reconstructed.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Duplicate Resources[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]It is quite possible to have two or more of the same resource within your borders. Except for each space's production, commerce, and food value (see "Working Resources" above), you gain no additional benefit from multiple resources; a single resource is enough to take care of all of your civilization's needs. You may wish to hold onto the extras in case one is captured by an enemy, or you may want to trade the extras to other civilizations in exchange for their extra resources (see below).[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Trading Resources[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]You can trade any resource to other civilizations if that resource has been improved, and if it is connected by your [LINK=CONCEPT_CITY_NETWORK]City Network[\LINK] to your capital city (see [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomacy[\LINK] for more details on trading).[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]资源[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]文明IV的世界中存在各种能为拥有者带来利益的“自然资源”。某些具有军事价值——“马匹”资源使城市可以组建骑乘单位，例如早期的[LINK=UNIT_CHARIOT]战车[\LINK]和启蒙时代的[LINK=UNIT_CAVALRY]近代骑兵[\LINK]。某些资源带来产出奖励——例如大理石可以减少建造[LINK=BUILDING_PARTHENON]帕特农神庙[\LINK]奇观需要的工程量。还有的资源能为城市带来健康和快乐，使其能成长到更大的规模和更强的实力。拥有多种资源的文明相对拥有较少资源的文明，具有巨大的优势，资源也是城市选址最重要的考虑因素之一。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]发现资源[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]某些资源——稻米，黄金等等。在游戏开始时就是可见的。只要达到其所在区域即可发现资源（见[LINK=CONCEPT_EXPLORATION]探索[\LINK]）。其他资源在开始时不可见：直到你获得特定的[LINK=CONCEPT_TECHNOLOGY]科技[\LINK]才会在显示出来。铜就是此类资源的一个例子；在游戏开始时地图上看不到铜，但当你获得[LINK=TECH_BRONZE_WORKING]青铜器[\LINK]科技，铜即被启用。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]资源位置[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]资源必须位于本文明的[LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]文化边界[\LINK]之内才能连入[LINK=CONCEPT_CITY_NETWORK]城市网络[\LINK]。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]获取资源[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]资源除了有特殊作用，通常还能为所在区域带来食物，商业或工业产出的奖励。例如，小麦资源能大量增加所在地的食物产出。如果资源位于城市范围之内，城市居民应该在资源所在地工作，获得更高的收益。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]资源与区域设施[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]要获取资源带来的特殊作用，需要修建相应的“区域设施”（详情见[LINK=CONCEPT_IMPROVEMENTS]区域设施[\LINK]）。区域设施由[LINK=UNIT_WORKER]工人[\LINK]修建（水上设施则由[LINK=UNIT_WORKBOAT]工船[\LINK]）修建。如果设施遭劫掠或被摧毁，你将失去资源带来的收益，直到重建设施。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]重复资源[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]你可能会拥有两个以上的同类资源。除了对区域的工业，商业和食物产出的奖励（见上文“获取资源”），重复资源并不会带来额外利益；一处资源即可满足整个文明的需要。但拥有额外资源可在一处资源被敌方占据时作为后备，也可以用来交换其他文明的额外资源（见下文）。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]资源贸易[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]你可以同其他文明开展资源贸易，前提是已建有相应区域设施并通过[LINK=CONCEPT_CITY_NETWORK]城市网络[\LINK]与你的首都相连（贸易的详情见[LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]外交[\LINK]一节）。[PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: [H1]Revolution[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]A "revolution" occurs when you change your civilization's [LINK=CONCEPT_CIVICS]Civics[\LINK] or [LINK=CONCEPT_RELIGION]Religion[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Effects of a Revolution[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]During a revolution your civilization descends into one or more turns of "anarchy." A civilization in anarchy produces no food, commerce, or production! Any progress towards completing buildings, units, or projects is stopped until the revolution is over.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Duration of a Revolution[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]The duration of a revolt depends upon the number of civics that you change: one or two civics will usually result in one turn of anarchy, while three or more civics may cause two or more turns of anarchy. The civics screen tells you how many turns of anarchy you may look forward to after you choose which civics to change. If the length of time is too long, either make fewer changes or cancel them altogether until you can spare the time. Religions always have one turn of revolution.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Immunity to Revolution[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Civilizations with [LINK=CONCEPT_LEADERS]Leaders[\LINK] possessing the "Spiritual" trait do not suffer the effects of revolution or anarchy at all.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Delay Period[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]After a revolution has taken place, there is a short period of delay before another revolution can be carried out. When the "Revolution" button appears once again on the civics screen, your citizens have recovered enough from the previous anarchy to carry out another revolution.[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]革命[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]“革命”会在你改变[LINK=CONCEPT_CIVICS]内政法令[\LINK]或[LINK=CONCEPT_RELIGION]宗教信仰[\LINK]时发生。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]革命的影响[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]在革命发生期间，你的文明将进入至少一个回合的“无政府状态.”处于无政府状态的文明将没有任何食物，商业和工业产出！所有建筑，单位或大型工程项目都将暂停，直到革命结束才可恢复。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]革命持续时间[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]革命持续时间由你同时改变的内政法令数量决定：改变一项或两项内政法令通常会导致一个回合的无政府状态，改变三项以上内政法令可能导致两个回合以上的无政府状态。当你进行内政调整时，内政法令界面将提示具体可能导致几个回合的无政府状态。如果持续回合数过多，可以减少调整项目或暂时取消调整。改变官方信仰将导致一个回合的无政府状态。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]对革命免疫[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]如果文明的[LINK=CONCEPT_LEADERS]领袖[\LINK]拥有“虔信神灵”特质，则可免受革命的影响。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]延迟期[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]在一场革命之后，在一段时期之内将不能再进行革命。直到内政法令界面中的“革命”按钮再次出现，你的文明才会从前一阶段的混乱状态影响中恢复过来，能够再次发动革命。[PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: [H1]Spaceship[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Constructing a spaceship and sending it on a successful journey to Alpha Centauri is one of the paths to victory. Alpha Centauri is the closest location of a potentially habitable world, so it has long been fantasized as the place most likely to contain other forms of intelligent life. Blasting into space with a ship capable of traveling to Alpha Centauri is a clear demonstration of the greatness of your civilization. Only an economical and scientific powerhouse could pull off such a feat.[PARAGRAPH:2]The spaceship components can only be built after discoverying most of the modern era technologies. In order to construct any of the spaceship components, you [BOLD]must[\BOLD] have first built the [LINK=PROJECT_APOLLO_PROGRAM]Apollo Program[\LINK]. Each component's production speed can be affected by several factors. Access to certain [LINK=CONCEPT_RESOURCES]Resources[\LINK] (most notably Aluminum) can provide production increases for certain components. A [LINK=BUILDING_LABORATORY]Laboratory[\LINK] in the city that is building the component always grants a 50%% increase in production speed. Finally, the [LINK=BUILDING_SPACE_ELEVATOR]Space Elevator[\LINK] wonder grants a 50%% increase in production on spaceship components [BOLD]for all cities[\BOLD].[PARAGRAPH:2]For more information about winning the game via the Spaceship, see the [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]Victory[\LINK] Civilopedia entry.[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]太空飞船[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]建造太空飞船并成功发射，开始飞往半人马座阿尔法星的远航是赢得胜利的方式之一。半人马座阿尔法星是距离我们最近的恒星，其中或许存在生存环境适宜的行星，因此许多幻想作品都相信那里居住着某种智慧生命。率先发射飞往半人马座阿尔法星的太空飞船，将确定无疑地彰显你的文明之伟大先进。只有经济最富庶，科技最昌明的强国才能做到这一点。[PARAGRAPH:2]建造太空飞船组件需要获得大部分信息时代科技。任何太空飞船组件的建造都[BOLD]必须[\BOLD]以完成[LINK=PROJECT_APOLLO_PROGRAM]阿波罗计划[\LINK]为前提。太空飞船组件的建造速度受以下几个因素的影响。拥有特定[LINK=CONCEPT_RESOURCES]资源[\LINK]（特别是铝）可加速某些太空飞船组件的建造。建有[LINK=BUILDING_LABORATORY]实验室[\LINK]的城市建造太空飞船组件的速度+50%%。最后，拥有[LINK=BUILDING_SPACE_ELEVATOR]天梯[\LINK]奇观可以使[BOLD]所有城市[\BOLD]的太空飞船组件建造速度+50%%。[PARAGRAPH:2]要了解通过发射太空飞船赢得游戏的详情，请查看文明百科中的[LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]胜利[\LINK]词条。[PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: [H1]Specialists[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]When a [LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]City[\LINK] is first founded, all of its citizens are bound in the various requirements of day-to-day survival: hunting, fishing, tilling the land, and so forth. This may continue for some time, but eventually the city may grow large and prosperous enough that it can afford to dedicate some of its population to more rewarding pursuits. In Civilization IV, these more useful citizens are called "Specialists."[PARAGRAPH:2]There are six categories of specialists in Civilization IV: Engineer, Merchant, Scientist, Artist, Priest, and the default "Citizen" specialist. Each provides a city certain benefits.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Requirements for Employing Specialists[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]At the start of the game, you may only create one kind of specialist: the Citizen, who is the least useful of all of them. Each of the other specialist types requires certain [LINK=CONCEPT_BUILDINGS]Buildings[\LINK] or [LINK=CONCEPT_WONDERS]Wonders[\LINK] to be created. Further, each building or wonder will allow a limited number of specialists. For example, building a Temple allows you to create one (and only one) Priest in its city. But if you subsequently build a Cathedral there, you can create an additional two priests, for a total of three.[PARAGRAPH:2]The [LINK=CIVIC_CASTE_SYSTEM]Caste System[\LINK] civic allows you to create as many Merchant, Scientist, and Artist specialists in a city as you desire, regardless of whether or not you have the buildings that would normally be needed to create them. Be aware, however, that there is no way to get around the limitation on the number of Engineers and Priests that a city can support; you must have either the buildings or wonders necessary to create these specialists.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Effects of Turning City Population into Specialists[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]When a city increases its population, it first seeks to employ that new population working the land around the city. (See [LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]Cities[\LINK].) If any land spaces are yet unworked, the city puts the new civilian on the space it thinks will do the most good. A city can work up to 20 spaces - fewer if the city contains deserts or peaks in its [LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]City Radius[\LINK]. If you turn one of those working populations into a specialist, it no longer works the land. It still must eat, however, so the city's remaining working population must provide enough food for everybody. If not, the city will begin to starve. As a general rule, therefore, cities with more food will be able to create more specialists; cities that are food-poor will need all of their citizens to work the land just to prevent starvation.[PARAGRAPH:2]Once a city is working all available land, it automatically turns any additional population into specialists (keep in mind this usually will not take place until very late in the game!). It attempts to create the most useful specialist available; if no other slots are open, it creates a citizen specialist. You can also manually create specialists yourself by removing citizens from working the land (see below). When a city is about to grow past the level of [LINK=CONCEPT_HAPPINESS]Happiness[\LINK] that it can support, it is often a good idea to turn some of the population into specialists and halt growth rather than let the city increase in size and produce useless unhappy citizens.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Specialists and Great People[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]In addition to their other functions described below, specialists increase a city's generation of "Great People Points" by +3 each. Specialists also help determine what kind of great person the city will generate. See [LINK=CONCEPT_GREAT_PEOPLE]Great People[\LINK] for more details.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]How to Create a Specialist[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]You can create a specialist on the city screen. The six types are visible on the right-hand edge of the screen. If a specialist type is grayed-out, you cannot build one. If a specialist is in full color, however, you can: click on the plus (+) sign next to the specialist you want to create. If you want to remove a specialist, click on the minus (-) sign. Creating a specialist removes one of your population points from working a tile in the City Radius.[PARAGRAPH:2]In order to manually select which tile to remove, first click on the tile that you want removed (the white circle around it should disappear). This creates a Citizen specialist. Then click on the plus (+) sign next to the specialist you want to employ, and the Citizen specialist will be replaced with the one you desire.[PARAGRAPH:2]Note that some [LINK=CONCEPT_WONDERS]Wonders[\LINK] automatically give you one or more specialists of a specific type; you can't remove or repurpose them at all. Some wonders and civics may also provide you with a free specialist in each city; in this case, you can choose which specialist to employ in each city, but cannot remove the specialist altogether.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Specialist Types[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Engineer[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Engineers increase a city's production by +2. They increase the city's great person generation rate by +3. They increase the chance that the city will generate a Great Engineer. [LINK=BUILDING_FORGE]Forges[\LINK], [LINK=BUILDING_FACTORY]Factories[\LINK], and similar industrial buildings are needed to create Engineers.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Merchant[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Merchants increase gold by +3. They increase the city's great person generation rate by +3. They increase the chance that the city will generate a Great Merchant. [LINK=BUILDING_MARKET]Markets[\LINK], [LINK=BUILDING_BANK]Banks[\LINK], and similar commercial buildings are needed to create Merchants.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Scientist[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Scientists increase a city's research rate by +3. They increase the city's great person generation rate by +3. They increase the chance that the city will generate a Great Scientist. [LINK=BUILDING_LIBRARY]Libraries[\LINK], [LINK=BUILDING_UNIVERSITY]Universities[\LINK], and similar research institutions are needed to create Scientists.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Artist[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Artists increase a city's research rate by +1, and its culture by +4. They increase the city's great person generation rate by +3. They increase the chance that the city will generate a Great Artist. [LINK=BUILDING_THEATRE]Theatres[\LINK] and other centers of the arts are needed to create Artists.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Priest[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Priests increase a city's commerce and production by +1 each. They increase the city's great person generation rate by +3. They increase the chance that the city will generate a Great Prophet. Temples, Cathedrals, and other religious buildings are needed to create Priests.[PARAGRAPH:2] [BOLD]Citizen[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Citizens increase a city's production by +1. They do not provide great person generation points, nor do they affect what kind of great person the city generates. Citizens require the construction of no buildings or wonders, and an unlimited number can always be employed. However, it is rarely worthwhile to create large numbers of Citizen specialists![PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Wonders and Civics[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Many wonders and civics can increase the power of specialists even further, with a variety of different effects.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Increased Great Person Points[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Several different wonders and civics increase the rate at which specialists create Great People. The [LINK=BUILDING_PARTHENON]Parthenon[\LINK] wonder increases the production of great person points by 50%% in all cities, and the [LINK=BUILDING_NATIONAL_EPIC]National Epic[\LINK] national wonder increases the rate by 100%% in the city in which it is built. The [LINK=CIVIC_PACIFISM]Pacifism[\LINK] civic also increases great person generation by 100%% in all cities.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Other Effects[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Other effects include increasing the output of the specialists themselves. For example, the [LINK=BUILDING_ANGKOR_WAT]Angkor Wat[\LINK] wonder adds +1 production to all Priest specialists, and the [LINK=BUILDING_SISTINE_CHAPEL]Sistine Chapel[\LINK] adds +2 culture to a ll specialists. The [LINK=CIVIC_REPRESENTATION]Representation[\LINK] civic also adds +3 research to all specialists. Since all of these effects are cumulative, specialists can become very powerful if enough attention is paid to them.[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]专业人员[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]当一座[LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]城市[\LINK]初建时，所有的居民均需每日从事劳作以保证生存：捕猎，打渔，耕作等等。这种状况将持续一段时间，但城市会逐步发展得更大和更繁荣，并足够的能力供养一部分人口从事更有意义的活动。在文明IV中，这种作用更大的城市居民被称为“专业人员.”[PARAGRAPH:2]在游戏中有六种类型的专业人员：工程师，商业家，科学家，艺术家，神学家，以及默认的空闲“市民”。每种类型能为城市带来不同的利益。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]供养专业人员的前提[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]在游戏开始时，你只能指定一种类型的专业人员：市民，市民的作用很小。其他类型的专业人员则需要建有特定的[LINK=CONCEPT_BUILDINGS]建筑[\LINK]或[LINK=CONCEPT_WONDERS]奇观[\LINK]。此外，每座建筑或奇观允许供养的专业人员数量也有一定限制。例如，建造寺庙使你能在该城市中供养一位（只能一位）神学家。但如果你再建造大教堂，你将可以再安置两位神学家，即总共三位。[PARAGRAPH:2]实行[LINK=CIVIC_CASTE_SYSTEM]等级社会[\LINK]内政法令使你可以供养任意数量的商业家，科学家和艺术家，而不论是否建有相应建筑。但是要注意，工程师和神学家的数量仍然会受到上述建筑或奇观条件的限制。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]将城市人口转为专业人员的作用[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]当城市人口不断增长，新增居民将先占据城市范围内的空地。（见[LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]城市[\LINK].）如果存在空地，新增居民将在最适宜的空地上定居。一座城市范围最多包括20个方格——如果[LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]城市范围[\LINK]内存在荒漠或山峰则可用方格将更少。如果你将其中一个方格中的居民转为专业人员，方格将变为可用空地。但专业人员也要消耗食物，城市的产出必须能满足全部人口的需要。否则，城市将发生饥荒。总而言之，城市食物产出越多，可供养的专业人员就越多；城市食物产出过少，则所有居民都必须在地块中劳作以避免挨饿。[PARAGRAPH:2]一旦城市的所有可用空地被占满，额外的人口将自动专为专业人员（注意通常只在游戏后期会出现此种情况!）。电脑将尽可能安排作用最大的专业人员；如果专业人员限制被占满，则将安置为市民。你也可以将居民移出所工作的地块，手动安置专业人员（见下文）。如果城市人口的增长即将超出[LINK=CONCEPT_HAPPINESS]快乐[\LINK]等级所支持的限度，则应该将部分人口转为专业人员减缓增长速度，而不是任其产生无用的不满的居民。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]专业人员和历史伟人[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]除了其他作用（见下文），每位专业人员还可使城市的“历史伟人点数”+3。专业人类的类型也会影响所产生的历史伟人类型。详情见[LINK=CONCEPT_GREAT_PEOPLE]历史伟人[\LINK]。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]如何产生历史伟人[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]你可以在城市界面中安置专业人员。六种类型显示在屏幕的右侧。如果某一类型呈灰色，则不可安置该类型人员。反之则可：点击相应类型人员右侧的加号（+）安置。如要移除一位专业人员，则点击减号（-）即可。增加专业人员则在城市方格工作的人口将相应减少。[PARAGRAPH:2]要手动选择要移除人口的方格，首先点击该方格（其周围的圆环将消失）。这将增加一个市民类型的专业人员。再点击某一类型人员右侧的加号（+），该市民将转化为该类型专业人员。[PARAGRAPH:2]注意某些[LINK=CONCEPT_WONDERS]奇观[\LINK]能够自动提供一位或多位特定类型的专业人员；在此情况下你将不能进行移除或调整。某些奇观和内政法令还可能为每座城市提供一位免费专业人员；在此情况下，你可以具体选择每座城市所供养的专业人员类型，但是不能将其移除。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]专业人员类型[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]工程师[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]工程师使城市工业产能+2。使城市历史伟人出现几率+3。使城市更可能产生大工程师。[LINK=BUILDING_FORGE]煅造场[\LINK]，[LINK=BUILDING_FACTORY]工厂[\LINK]，及类似工业建筑是供养工程师的前提。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]商业家[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]商业家使城市商业收入+3。使城市历史伟人出现几率+3。使城市更可能产生大商业家。[LINK=BUILDING_MARKET]市场[\LINK]，[LINK=BUILDING_BANK]银行[\LINK]，及类似商业建筑是供养商业家的前提。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]科学家[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]科学家使城市科研点数+3。使城市历史伟人出现几率+3。使城市更可能产生大科学家。[LINK=BUILDING_LIBRARY]实验室[\LINK]，[LINK=BUILDING_UNIVERSITY]大学[\LINK]，及类似科研机构是供养科学家的前提。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]艺术家[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]艺术家使城市科研点数+1，文化+4。使城市历史伟人出现几率+3。使城市更可能产生大艺术家。[LINK=BUILDING_THEATRE]剧场[\LINK]及其他艺术设施是供养艺术家的前提。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]神学家[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]神学家使城市商业收入与工业产出同时+1。使城市历史伟人出现几率+3。使城市更可能产生大预言家。寺庙，大教堂，及其他宗教建筑是供养神学前的前提。 [PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]市民[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]市民使城市工业产能+1。但不增加历史伟人点数，也不影响城市产生历史伟人的类型。供养市民没有任何建筑前提，也没有数量限制。但是，安置大量市民型专业人员并没有多少价值![PARAGRAPH:2][H2]奇观与内政法令[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]许多奇观和内政法令可进一步提升专业人员的作用，具体影响各不相同。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]增加历史伟人点数[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]某些奇观与内政法令可提升专业人员产生历史伟人的几率。[LINK=BUILDING_PARTHENON]帕特农神庙[\LINK]奇观可使所有城市的历史伟人出现几率+50%%，而[LINK=BUILDING_NATIONAL_EPIC]民族史诗[\LINK]国家奇观可使所在城市历史伟人出现几率+100%%。[LINK=CIVIC_PACIFISM]和平主义[\LINK]内政法令也可使所有城市的历史伟人出现几率+100%%。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]其他作用[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]其他作用包括提升专业人员本身带来的产出。例如，[LINK=BUILDING_ANGKOR_WAT]吴哥窟[\LINK]奇观使所有神学家的产出作用+1，而[LINK=BUILDING_SISTINE_CHAPEL]西斯廷教堂[\LINK]使所有专业人员额外+2文化点数。[LINK=CIVIC_REPRESENTATION]代议制度[\LINK]内政法令使所有专业人员额外+3科研点数。所有这些作用均可累加，因此只要安排得法，专业人员将发挥巨大的效果。[PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: [H1]Spies[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Spies are special "invisible" units which can sneak around the map and have a variety of special abilities. Spies also function defensively by increasing the odds of an enemy spy being exposed if it performs a mission in a nearby tiles.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Constructing Spies[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Spies may be built only in a city with the [LINK=BUILDING_SCOTLAND_YARD]Scotland Yard[\LINK] national wonder.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Invisible[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Spy units are invisible. They cannot be seen, attacked, or otherwise interacted with.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Movement[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Spies move like other units, except that they do not cause an automatic declaration of war when crossing foreign [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Borders[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Spy Missions[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Spies may perform a variety of missions, some of which are automatically fatal and others of which contain a chance of destruction. Spies can perform these missions anywhere on the map, including in territory belonging to allies or to civilizations you are at war with.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Exploration[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Being invisible, spies can move through neutral, friendly and enemy territory without risk.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Investigate City[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Upon entering a foreign city, a spy may look at it's City Screen and thus know important things, like what defenses the city contains, what it is currently building, and so forth.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Destroy Production[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]A spy performs this in a city. If successful, the spy survives and the city loses half of the production points towards whatever it is currently producing. For example, this can be quite devastating if the city is just a couple of turns from completing construction of a wonder. If the mission is unsuccessful, no production is lost and the spy is destroyed.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Sabotage Improvement[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]This is performed on any space containing an [LINK=CONCEPT_IMPROVEMENTS]Improvement[\LINK]. If successful, the improvement is destroyed and the spy survives. If unsuccessful, the spy is destroyed and the improvement survives.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Steal Plans[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]This mission has a much higher chance of success in one of a civilization's "centers of government" - a city containing the [LINK=BUILDING_PALACE]Palace[\LINK], [LINK=BUILDING_GREAT_PALACE]Forbidden Palace[\LINK] or [LINK=BUILDING_VERSAILLES]Versailles[\LINK] wonder. If successful, the spy survives and you get to see everything that is visible to the foreign civilization. This includes everything in its territory or within sight of its units and borders. If unsuccessful, the spy dies and you don't get to see anything.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Determining Success or Failure of a Spy Mission[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]The odds of success or failure of a spy's mission depend upon the number of units the other player has in the space the mission takes place. If a space is unoccupied, the chances of success are quite high. The chances of detection and failure increase with each unit in the target space. Further, nearby enemy spies significantly increase the chances of being caught.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Diplomatic Effects of Missions[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]If a mission is successful, the target civilization will not know who performed the mission; thus that civilization's opinion of you will not change (see [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomacy[\LINK]). If the mission is a failure, the target civilization will know exactly who is responsible for the outrage and will adjust its opinion of you appropriately. It is quite possible for a failed spy mission to cause the victim civilization to declare war on your civilization![PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]间谍[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]间谍是特殊的“隐身”单位，可以四处潜行，具有许多特殊能力。间谍也可以作为防御性单位，用于发现敌方派来的间谍。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]训练间谍[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]间谍只能在建有[LINK=BUILDING_SCOTLAND_YARD]苏格兰场[\LINK]国家奇观的城市建造。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]隐身[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]间谍单位有隐身能力。他不能被普通单位所发现和攻击。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]移动[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]间谍的移动方式与其他单位类似，但是其在穿越别国[LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]边界[\LINK]时不会引发战争。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]间谍的任务[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]间谍可以执行多种任务，有些必然发生作用，有些则有特定成功几率。间谍可在任何地方执行任务，包括在盟国和敌国的领土范围之内。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]探索[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]由于有隐身能力，间谍能够安全地通行于中立，友好和敌对方的领土。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]侦察城市[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]间谍进入别国城市时，可以查看城市界面了解重要信息，例如城市的防御设施，当前建造项目等等。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]破坏工程项目[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]间谍可在城市中执行此种任务。如果成功，间谍将存活下来，城市将失去当前建造项目所积累工业值的一半。如果此时城市只差几回合就能完成一座奇观，就会对其造成严重的打击。如果任务失败，则不会减少工业值，并将失去该间谍。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]破坏区域设施[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]间谍可在任何建有[LINK=CONCEPT_IMPROVEMENTS]区域设施[\LINK]的地方执行此种任务。如果成功，该设施将被摧毁，间谍继续存活。如果失败，失去间谍，保留设施。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]窃取计划[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]此种任务如在文明的“政治中心”——即建有[LINK=BUILDING_PALACE]宫殿[\LINK]，[LINK=BUILDING_GREAT_PALACE]紫禁城[\LINK]或[LINK=BUILDING_VERSAILLES]凡尔赛宫[\LINK]奇观的城市执行将有更高的成功率。如果成功，间谍将存活，你将可以查看该文明的一切信息。包括其全部领土及其单位视野所及的范围。如果失败，间谍消失，你什么也看不到。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]决定间谍任务成败的因素[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]间谍任务的成功几率与所在地的对方单位数量有关。如果当地无单位驻守，成功几率将很高。每增加一个驻守单位，失败几率就上升一点。此外，如果附近存在敌方间谍，任务失败的几率将大大提升。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]间谍活动对外交的影响[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]如果间谍任务成功，对方文明将对此一无所知；因而不会影响其对你的态度（见[LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]外交[\LINK]一节）。如果任务失败，对方文明将知晓是何人所为并相应调整对你的态度。一次失败的间谍行动很可能会导致对方文明向你宣战![PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: [H1]Technology[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Judged strictly upon his physical capabilities, man is not a particularly well-designed animal. Other animals are faster and stronger, others have keener senses, and others are far better equipped for combat. None, however, is as good as man at "technology" - the ability to create practical applications based upon knowledge of his environment.[PARAGRAPH:2]Take the wheel, for example. Many creatures - mountain goats, for instance - are probably well aware that round rocks move more easily than do flat ones. But beyond figuring out that leaping onto round rocks is a good way to break their neck, goats have not otherwise exploited that knowledge. Man, on the other hand, figured out a way to use that knowledge to his great advantage: he created the technology of the wheel.[PARAGRAPH:2]There are over 80 technologies available in Civilization IV, each representing an important advance in mankind's ability to manipulate the environment.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Acquiring Technology[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Each civilization begins the game with knowledge of several primitive technologies. This list varies from civilization to civilization: one may know [LINK=TECH_THE_WHEEL]The Wheel[\LINK] and [LINK=TECH_AGRICULTURE]Agriculture[\LINK], while another may know [LINK=TECH_MYSTICISM]Mysticism[\LINK] and [LINK=TECH_FISHING]Fishing[\LINK]. Beyond the known technologies, there are a number of ways to acquire new ones:[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Friendly Villages[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]As your units [LINK=CONCEPT_EXPLORATION]Explore[\LINK] the world, they may encounter tribal villages. These villages may attack your explorers, or they may give them maps, money, or new technology. You need to find them quickly, however; there are only a limited number of tribal villages on the map, and all civilizations want them.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Diplomacy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]As the game progresses, you will be able to acquire technologies from other civilizations through trade. See [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomacy[\LINK] for details.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Research[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]You can discover new technologies on your own, through [LINK=CONCEPT_RESEARCH]Research[\LINK]. This is the most common way to acquire technologies. See that section for details.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Choosing Techs to Research[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]When you have completed research and learned a new technology, the "choose a technology" menu appears and you must choose another technology to begin researching. At that time the game will provide a list of available technologies for you to choose from. Many techs have "prerequisite technologies" that you must know before you can learn the new technology - for instance, you need to know the [LINK=TECH_ANIMAL_HUSBANDRY]Animal Husbandry[\LINK] tech before you can study [LINK=TECH_HORSEBACK_RIDING]Horseback Riding[\LINK] and get the versatile [LINK=UNIT_HORSE_ARCHER]Horse Archer[\LINK] units.[PARAGRAPH:2]Some technologies may have multiple prerequisites to begin researching them; other technologies require one tech OR another tech to research. [LINK=TECH_MONOTHEISM]Monotheism[\LINK] is an example of the first group; it requires [LINK=TECH_POLYTHEISM]Polytheism[\LINK] AND [LINK=TECH_MASONRY]Masonry[\LINK]. [LINK=TECH_ANIMAL_HUSBANDRY]Animal Husbandry[\LINK] is an example of the second group; it requires [LINK=TECH_HUNTING]Hunting[\LINK] OR [LINK=TECH_AGRICULTURE]Agriculture[\LINK], but not both. A tech will appear on your list only when you have learned the necessary prerequisite technologies.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]The Tech Tree[\BOLD]: The extremely useful Technology Tree (F6) displays all of the technologies in the game and how they are interrelated. You can select which tech to research from the tree, or choose a research path by clicking on a tech that you want which is not currently available to be researched. The game will choose the shortest possible path to reach the tech you have selected.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Time to Research[\BOLD]: Each technology requires a certain number of "research points" to learn. The "choose a technology" screen lists the number of turns it will take to learn each technology - at your CURRENT research rate. See [LINK=CONCEPT_RESEARCH]Research[\LINK] to learn how to increase your research rate and thus shorten the time it takes to learn new technologies.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Changing Research[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]You are free to change what your civilization is researching at any point in time. You can do this by clicking on the research bar at the top of the main game screen, or by opening up the Tech Tree (see above) and selecting a different tech there. Unlike previous Civilization games, there is no penalty for changing research paths. You can research half of one technology, change to a second technology and finish it, then return to the first one and pick up right where you left off before.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Effects of Technology[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Technologies allow you to do cool stuff: build new units, wonders and buildings, change your civics, discover a new religion, trade different stuff with other civilizations, and so forth. Some techs give special bonuses to the civilization that first discovers them. Note that some techs render some [LINK=CONCEPT_WONDERS]Wonders[\LINK] obsolete.[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]科技[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]如果根据身体力量进行评判，人类不能算是一种完善的动物。其他动物有的速度更快，有的力量更强，有的感觉更灵敏，还有的天生配备撕裂对手的武器。但是没有一种其他动物能象人类一样掌握“科学技术”——根据对周围环境的知识制造实用工具的能力。[PARAGRAPH:2]以轮子为例。许多动物——例如山羊——也许都了解圆形石头比方形石头更易移动。但山羊最多只明白跳到圆形石头上可能摔断脖子，但绝不可能设法利用这一知识。而人类却不同，他们发现这一知识能为自己带来好处：轮子科技就此诞生。[PARAGRAPH:2]文明IV中有超过80种的科技，每种科技都代表了人类改变周围环境能力的重要进步。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]获取科技[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]每个文明在游戏开始时都拥有几项初级科技。不同文明拥有不同的初始科技：有的已发现[LINK=TECH_THE_WHEEL]轮子[\LINK]和[LINK=TECH_AGRICULTURE]农业[\LINK]，有的可能掌握了[LINK=TECH_MYSTICISM]神秘学[\LINK]和[LINK=TECH_FISHING]渔业[\LINK]。要获得初始科技以外的新科技有多种方式:[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]友好的村庄[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]在你的单位[LINK=CONCEPT_EXPLORATION]探索[\LINK]世界时，他们可能找到部落村庄。这些村庄可能与你为敌，也可能提供给你地图，金钱，或是新的科技。但你需要快一点找到他们；地图上的部落村庄数量有限，其他文明可能抢先一步。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]外交[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]随着游戏的进展，你将可能从通过交易从其他文明获得科技。详情见[LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]外交[\LINK]一节。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]科研[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]你可以通过[LINK=CONCEPT_RESEARCH]科研[\LINK]自力更生发现新科技。这是获取科技最常用的方式。详情见相关小节。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]选择要研究的科技[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]当你完成一项科技的研究后，将出现“选择一项科技”菜单供你挑选接下来要研究的科技。菜单将列出所有可研究研究的科技。许多科技都有在研究之前必须已经掌握的“前提科技”——例如，你需要先获得[LINK=TECH_ANIMAL_HUSBANDRY]动物驯养[\LINK]科技才能研究[LINK=TECH_HORSEBACK_RIDING]骑术[\LINK]，以启用灵活机动的[LINK=UNIT_HORSE_ARCHER]骑射手[\LINK]单位。[PARAGRAPH:2]有的科技可能有多个前提科技；还有的科技可能需要某两项科技的其中任何一项作为前提。例如[LINK=TECH_MONOTHEISM]一神论[\LINK]就同时需要[LINK=TECH_POLYTHEISM]多神论[\LINK]以及[LINK=TECH_MASONRY]石工术[\LINK]。而[LINK=TECH_ANIMAL_HUSBANDRY]动物驯养[\LINK]就是需要[LINK=TECH_HUNTING]捕猎[\LINK]或者[LINK=TECH_AGRICULTURE]农业[\LINK]，但不必两者兼有。只有满足研究前提的科技才会在科技研究的选择清单中显示。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]科技树[\BOLD]：科技树界面（F6）显示游戏中所有的科技及相互之间的关系。你可以在科技树中选择一项当前要研究的科技，或点击一项当前不可研究的科技来设置研究路线。电脑将选择一条通往所选科技的最短研究路线。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]研究时间[\BOLD]：完成每项科技研究都需要付出一定的“科研点数”。“选择一项科技”菜单会标示完成每项科技研究所需的回合数——基于当前的科研能力。有关如何提升科研能力，减少研究时间的方法详见[LINK=CONCEPT_RESEARCH]科研[\LINK]一节。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]改变科研项目[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]你可以在任何时候改变当前科研项目。你可以点击主界面顶部的科研栏，或打开科技树（见上文）选择另一项科技。但与前代游戏不同，改变科研项目并没有惩罚性规则。你可以在研究某项科技的半途转而研究另一项科技，在发现另一项科技之后转回前一项科技的研究而不损失原有进度。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]科技的作用[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]科技使你能够做许多事情：建造新的单位，奇观和建筑，改变内政法令，创立新宗教，与其他文明开展各种交易等等。有的科技还能给予率先发现者特殊奖励。但要注意，某些科技会使得某些[LINK=CONCEPT_WONDERS]奇观[\LINK]过时。[PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: [H1]Terrain[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]In Civilization IV, the world is made up of land and water "squares." Each square is designated as a specific "terrain type": for example, desert, hills, plains, coast, ocean, etc. Each may contain additional "features": forest, jungle, oasis, and so forth. A river may run along the edge of the square as well. All of these elements help determine the usefulness of the square as a place to build a city, as well as how easy or difficult it is to move through the square. And, of course, terrain may have important effects on any combat taking place in a square. The charts below display all of the effects of terrain on the game.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Land and Sea[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]All squares are either land or water squares. Water units cannot enter land spaces (except for coastal cities), and land units cannot enter water squares (unless carried aboard [LINK=CONCEPT_TRANSPORT]Transport Vessels[\LINK]). Some air units can enter both types. (See [LINK=CONCEPT_AIR_UNITS]Air Units[\LINK] for details on air units.)[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Terrain Effects on Movement[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Some terrain is more difficult to move through than others. See [LINK=CONCEPT_MOVEMENT]Movement[\LINK] for details.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Combat Effects of Terrain[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]When two units fight each other in open terrain, both fight at their standard [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Combat Strength[\LINK]. Some terrain gives benefits to the defender - for example, most units get "defensive bonuses" when they are occupying hills or forests. Such bonuses serve to temporarily increase the defender's strength for that battle. For example, a spearman at full strength (with a strength of 4) who is attacked while in a forest, gets a 25%% defensive bonus; for that battle, his strength is increased to 5. However, if that spearman were to attack, he would get no bonus from the forest - defensive bonuses only go to the defender. See the [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Combat[\LINK] entry for more information.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Terrain Productivity[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Cities draw sustenance from the squares they occupy, and from nearby surrounding squares. Each terrain-type and feature provides a certain amount of [LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]Food[\LINK], [LINK=CONCEPT_COMMERCE]Commerce[\LINK], and [LINK=CONCEPT_PRODUCTION]Production[\LINK] to cities; the higher these values, the better for the city. Note that [LINK=CONCEPT_RESOURCES]Resources[\LINK] will further increase a square's value, as will various worker [LINK=CONCEPT_IMPROVEMENTS]Improvements[\LINK]. See [LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]Cities[\LINK] for more details.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Rivers[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Unlike other terrain features, rivers run alongside land squares, not in them. Rivers can affect all squares they run adjacent to. Rivers negate the movement benefit of roads until you acquire the [LINK=TECH_CONSTRUCTION]Construction[\LINK] technology. Rivers also reduce an attacker's combat strength when the target is on the other side of the river. Rivers improve the commerce value of adjacent squares as well.[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]地形[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]在文明IV中，整个世界是由陆地或水面“方格”构成的，每个方格均属于一个特定的“地形”：例如，荒漠，丘陵，平原，海滨，大洋等等。每种地形还可能有附加“特性”：森林，丛林，绿洲等等。方格的边缘还可能有河流经过。这些元素将影响该地块是否适于建造城市，以及在该方块上移动的容易程度。当然，地形也对其上所发生的战斗有一定的影响。下面的表格显示了游戏中所有地形的效果。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]陆地与海洋[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]所有方格或是陆地，或是水域。水上单位不能进入陆地（除了海滨城市），陆地单位也不能进入水面方格（除非由[LINK=CONCEPT_TRANSPORT]运输舰船[\LINK]运载）。某些空中单位在两种地形中均可通行。（详情见[LINK=CONCEPT_AIR_UNITS]空中单位[\LINK]一节.）[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]地形对移动的影响[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]某些地形比其他地形更难通行。详情见[LINK=CONCEPT_MOVEMENT]移动[\LINK]一节。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]地形对战斗的影响[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]当两个单位进行战斗时，除了受其[LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]战斗力[\LINK]影响。有些地形能为防御方提供奖励——例如，多数单位在占据丘陵或森林时可获得“防御奖励加成”。这种奖励能临时性了提升防御方的战斗力。例如，一个满员的矛兵单位（战斗力为4）如在森林中遭到攻击，将获得25%%的防御加成；即其实际战斗力将为5。但是，如果是矛兵主动进攻，则不能获得森林地形的奖励——防御加成只对防御方起作用。详情见[LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]战斗[\LINK]一节。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]地形产出[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]城市的产出来自于其所占据的方格，以及附近的方格。每种地形和地形特性均可为城市提供一定数量的[LINK=CONCEPT_FOOD]食物[\LINK]，[LINK=CONCEPT_COMMERCE]商业[\LINK]，和[LINK=CONCEPT_PRODUCTION]工业[\LINK]；数值越高，城市的收益越大。注意各种[LINK=CONCEPT_RESOURCES]资源[\LINK]以及工人修建的[LINK=CONCEPT_IMPROVEMENTS]地形设施[\LINK]还可进一步提升某个方格的产出。详情见[LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]城市[\LINK]一节。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]河流[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]与其他地形特性不同，河流出现在陆地方格的边缘而不其在其内部。河流可对相邻的所有地块产生影响。河流会抵消道路对移动力的提升作用，除非已获得[LINK=TECH_CONSTRUCTION]建筑构造学[\LINK]科技。河流还能降低进攻方的战斗力（如果目标在河流对岸）。河流还能提升相邻方格的商业收入。[PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: [H1]Trade[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]You can trade a number of useful things with other civilizations: [LINK=CONCEPT_RESOURCES]Resources[\LINK], [LINK=CONCEPT_TECHNOLOGY]Technologies[\LINK], [LINK=CONCEPT_WEALTH]Gold[\LINK], [LINK=CONCEPT_MAPS]Maps[\LINK], and even [LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]Cities[\LINK]. You can only trade with civilizations that you have met, and you need certain technologies in order to trade certain items. See [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomacy[\LINK] for detailed information on trade.[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]贸易[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]你可以与其他文明开展贸易，交易各种有用的东西:[LINK=CONCEPT_RESOURCES]资源[\LINK]，[LINK=CONCEPT_TECHNOLOGY]科技[\LINK]，[LINK=CONCEPT_WEALTH]金钱[\LINK]，[LINK=CONCEPT_MAPS]地图[\LINK]，甚至[LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]城市[\LINK]。你只能同与你有联系的文明进行贸易，交易某些对象还需要特定科技。关于外交贸易的详情见[LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]外交[\LINK]一节。[PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: [H1]Transport[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]In the world, all land masses are not linked together. Islands and continents may be separated from each other by miles and miles of ocean. Needless to say, land units cannot walk on water: they need "naval transports" to carry them.[PARAGRAPH:2] [H2]Transport Types[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]There are six naval transport units in the game. Some may carry only specific types of units, while others may not leave the coastline or waters inside their [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Cultural Borders[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Galley[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]The [LINK=UNIT_GALLEY]Galley[\LINK] is the earliest transport unit. It can carry up to two land units of any type. The galley must remain in coastal spaces or spaces within your cultural borders (or within the cultural borders of civilizations you have [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Open Borders[\LINK] agreements with).[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Caravel[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]The [LINK=UNIT_CARAVEL]Caravel[\LINK] may carry one [LINK=CONCEPT_GREAT_PEOPLE]Great Person[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_BUDDHIST_MISSIONARY]Missionary[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_SCOUT]Scout[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_EXPLORER]Explorer[\LINK], or [LINK=UNIT_SPY]Spy[\LINK]. The caravel is the first naval unit that can enter all ocean spaces. Unlike most units, Caravels do not trigger war when entering other civilizations' territories.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Galleon[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]The [LINK=UNIT_GALLEON]Galleon[\LINK] can carry three land units of any type. It can enter all ocean spaces.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Transport[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]The [LINK=CONCEPT_TRANSPORT]Transport[\LINK] can carry four land units of any type. It can enter all ocean spaces.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Submarine[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]The [LINK=UNIT_SUBMARINE]Submarine[\LINK] is invisible to most units. It can carry one [LINK=CONCEPT_GREAT_PEOPLE]Great Person[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_BUDDHIST_MISSIONARY]Missionary[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_SCOUT]Scout[\LINK], [LINK=UNIT_EXPLORER]Explorer[\LINK], or [LINK=UNIT_SPY]Spy[\LINK]. Submarines can enter all ocean spaces. Subs do not trigger war when entering other civilizations' territories.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Aircraft Carrier[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]The [LINK=UNIT_CARRIER]Aircraft Carrier[\LINK] can carry three [LINK=UNIT_FIGHTER]Fighters[\LINK] and/or [LINK=UNIT_JET_FIGHTER]Jet Fighters[\LINK]. It can enter all water spaces.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Loading Land Units onto Transports[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]If a unit is in a coastal city that is also occupied by a transport that can carry that unit, activate the unit and click on the "board transport" action button. If a transport is in a coastal space, direct the unit to move into the transport's space and it will load automatically. A unit will not board a transport if the transport is full or if it is not allowed aboard that type of vessel. Loading a unit onto a transport uses up any remaining movement points that unit may have had that turn.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Unloading Transports[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]If a transport is in a city, click on the unit you want to unload and then click on the "exit transport" action button. If the transport is in a coastal square, you can order the transport to move onto a land square and all units aboard will exit onto that space. If you wish to unload just one of the transported units, activate the specific unit and order it to move to an adjacent land space. Unloading a unit uses up all of the unit's movement points for that turn.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Loading and Offloading Carriers[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]To load a fighter onto a carrier, activate the fighter and then right-click on the carrier. To offload a fighter from a carrier, activate the fighter and then right-click on a friendly city.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Sinking Transports[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Transports can fight like any other naval vessels. If a transport is sunk, all of the units it carries go down with the ship. Land units cannot fight when loaded aboard transports; fighters can, if given the appropriate mission (see [LINK=CONCEPT_AIR_UNITS]Air Units[\LINK] for details).[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Transporting Gunships[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2][LINK=UNIT_GUNSHIP]Gunships[\LINK] (combat helicopters) can be transported by galleys, galleons, and transports and are treated just like other land units. They CANNOT ride on carriers.[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]运输[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]在游戏的世界中，不是所有的陆地都彼此相连。岛屿和大陆之间由广阔的大洋分隔。显然，陆地单位不能在水上移动：需要“水上运输单位”运送他们。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]运输单位类型[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]游戏中共有六种水上运输单位。有些只能运送特定类型的单位，有些不能离开海岸线或超出本国[LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]文化边界[\LINK]。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]桨帆船[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2][LINK=UNIT_GALLEY]桨帆船[\LINK]是最早的运输单位。它可以运送两个任意类型的陆地单位。桨帆船必须在海滨区域或本国文化边界以内航行（也可进入别国文化边界，如果双方签有[LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]开放边界[\LINK]条约）。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]轻帆船[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2][LINK=UNIT_CARAVEL]轻帆船[\LINK]可以运送一位[LINK=CONCEPT_GREAT_PEOPLE]历史伟人[\LINK]，[LINK=UNIT_BUDDHIST_MISSIONARY]传教士[\LINK]，[LINK=UNIT_SCOUT]侦察兵[\LINK]，[LINK=UNIT_EXPLORER]探险家[\LINK]，或[LINK=UNIT_SPY]间谍[\LINK]。轻帆船是第一种能进入大洋区域的水上单位。与其他单位不同，轻帆船进入别国领海不会引发战争。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]大帆船[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2][LINK=UNIT_GALLEON]大帆船[\LINK]可以运送三个任意类型的陆地单位。它可以进入所有海域。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]运输舰[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2][LINK=CONCEPT_TRANSPORT]运输舰[\LINK]可以运送四个任意类型的陆地单位。它可以进入所有海域。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]潜艇[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2][LINK=UNIT_SUBMARINE]潜艇[\LINK]对多数其他单位不可见。可以运送一位[LINK=CONCEPT_GREAT_PEOPLE]历史伟人[\LINK]，[LINK=UNIT_BUDDHIST_MISSIONARY]传教士[\LINK]，[LINK=UNIT_SCOUT]侦察兵[\LINK]，[LINK=UNIT_EXPLORER]探险家[\LINK]，或[LINK=UNIT_SPY]间谍[\LINK]。潜艇可进入所有海域。潜艇进入别国领海不会引发战争。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]航空母舰[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2][LINK=UNIT_CARRIER]航空母舰[\LINK]可以装载三个[LINK=UNIT_FIGHTER]战斗机[\LINK]或[LINK=UNIT_JET_FIGHTER]喷气式战斗机[\LINK]单位。它可以进入所有海域。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]装载陆地单位到运输单位[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]如果一个陆地单位和一个运输单位在同一个海滨城市中，则可激活陆地单位并点击“装载”命令按钮。如果一个运输单位位于海滨区域，可将陆地单位移至运输单位所在区域即可自动装载。如果运输单位已满或类型不符将不能装载。装载命令将消耗陆地单位本回合的全部移动力。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]卸载运输单位[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]如果运输单位位于城市，点击运输单位并点击“卸载”命令按钮。如果运输单位位于海滨区域，可命令运输单位移向陆地区域，其所装载的单位将自动登陆。如果你只希望其中一个单位登陆，可激活该单位并将其移至相邻陆地。卸载命令将消耗陆地单位本回合的全部移动力。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]装载和卸载航空母舰[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]要装载战斗机到航空母舰，激活战斗机并右击航空母舰即可。要从航空母舰卸载战斗机，激活战斗机并右击本方城市即可。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]击沉运输单位[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]水上运输单位可象其他水上单位一样进行战斗。如果运输单位被击沉，其中装载的单位也将一同沉没。陆地单位在运输单位中不能进行战斗；战斗机则可执行战斗任务（详情见[LINK=CONCEPT_AIR_UNITS]空中单位[\LINK]一节）。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]运送武装直升机[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2][LINK=UNIT_GUNSHIP]武装直升机[\LINK]（“空中炮艇”）可以和其他陆地单位一样由帆桨船，大帆船或运输舰运送。但不能装载到航空母舰。[PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: [H1]Treasury[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Your treasury shows how much wealth your civilization possesses. This must be a positive number or zero, or else your civilization will start selling off units and buildings to pay the costs. See [LINK=CONCEPT_WEALTH]Wealth[\LINK] for information on money and its many uses in the game.[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]国库[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]你的国库储备指当前所拥有的金钱财富数额。这应该是正值或零，否则你的文明将解散单位变卖建筑以弥补亏空。金钱的概念及其作用的详情见[LINK=CONCEPT_WEALTH]财富[\LINK]一节。[PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: [H1]United Nations[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]The United Nations is an important great wonder that can be built at the end of the game after a civilization discovers the [LINK=TECH_MASS_MEDIA]Mass Media[\LINK] technology. The construction of the United Nations opens up the possibility of a [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]Diplomatic Victory[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Voting[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Once the United Nations has been built anywhere in the world, votes will begin being held every few turns. Every civilization that is still alive participates in these votes, regardless of how strong or weak they may be. The number of votes that a civilization receives is determined by population; the larger the population of a civilization, the more votes that its leader casts in United Nations elections.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Types of Votes[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Secretary General Elections[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]The first United Nations vote will always be to determine which leader will be selected as Secretary General (see below for more information on the powers granted to the Secretary General). The civilization that builds the United Nations will always be one of the two candidates to stand for Secretary General; the other candidate for Secretary General will be the leader whose civilization has the highest population (or second-highest if that is the civilization who builds the United Nations). When voting for the Secretary General, each civilization will choose one of the two candidates to cast their votes in favor of, or can choose to abstain altogether. If one of the two candidates receives a majority of the total votes (including the civilizations who abstain), that candidate becomes the Secretary General. If there is no majority, the election is inconclusive and there will be another election for Secretary General again a few turns later. Nothing else may be accomplished until the United Nations selects a Secretary General.[PARAGRAPH:2]When a Secretary General has been chosen, he or she can choose from a list of the following resolutions to put to a vote. After three such resolutions have been voted upon, there is a new election for Secretary General, and the process repeats. Unlike the simple majority vote to determine the Secretary General, all of the following resolutions require 60 percent or greater of the total votes to be adopted.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Single Currency[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Adopting a Single Currency for the entire globe will naturally increase trade and commerce. Every city in the world receives an extra trade route.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Free Trade[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Adopting the Free Trade resolution removes all barriers to trade everywhere in the world. Trade routes function as though all civs have Open Borders with one another regardless of what their diplomatic situation may be.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]No Nukes[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Adopting this resolution causes an end to the proliferation of nuclear weapons. No civilizations anywhere in the world can construct nuclear weapons (although existing nukes do not disappear).[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Universal Suffrage[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Adopting this resolution forces all civilizations to change to the civic [LINK=CIVIC_UNIVERSAL_SUFFRAGE]Universal Suffrage[\LINK], regardless of whether or not they possess the technology to do so normally.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Free Speech[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Adopting this resolution forces all civilizations to change to the civic [LINK=CIVIC_FREE_SPEECH]Free Speech[\LINK], regardless of whether or not they possess the technology to do so normally.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Emancipation[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Adopting this resolution forces all civilizations to change to the civic [LINK=CIVIC_EMANCIPATION]Emancipation[\LINK], regardless of whether or not they possess the technology to do so normally.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Environmentalism[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Adopting this resolution forces all civilizations to change to the civic [LINK=CIVIC_ENVIRONMENTALISM]Environmentalism[\LINK], regardless of whether or not they possess the technology to do so normally.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Free Religion[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Adopting this resolution forces all civilizations to change to the civic [LINK=CIVIC_FREE_RELIGION]Free Religion[\LINK], regardless of whether or not they possess the technology to do so normally.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Diplomatic Victory[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]The Secretary General may also put him or herself up for a Diplomatic Victory. With enough votes from the other civilizations of the world, he or she can win the game through becoming the undisputed leader of the United Nations. Who said nice guys finish last?[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]联合国[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]联合国是游戏后期重要的大奇观，获得[LINK=TECH_MASS_MEDIA]大众传媒[\LINK]科技后将可建造。建成联合国将启用[LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]外交胜利[\LINK]。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]投票[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]一旦任何一个文明建成联合国，每隔数个回合将进行联合国投票。所有仍然存在的文明都有投票权，不论其力量强弱。一个文明所拥有的选票数由其人口决定；人口越多，文明领袖在联合国中的投票权越多。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]投票类型[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]选举秘书长[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]联合国进行的第一次投票决定哪位文明领袖担任联合国秘书长（有关秘书长职权的详情见下文）。建成联合国的文明是两位秘书长候选人之一；另一位则是人口最多的文明的领袖（建立联合国的文明除外）。在选举秘书长时，每个文明可以选择支持某位候选人，也可投弃权票。如果某位候选人得票达到多数（总票数包括弃权票），即可当选秘书长。如果无人达到多数，则选举无效，将在数回合后重新选举秘书长。联合国必须选出秘书长后才能进行其他活动。[PARAGRAPH:2]秘书长经选举产生后，将可选择一项决议案提交表决。完成三项决议案的表决之后，将重新开始秘书长的选举，如此周而复始。当选秘书长只须简单多数，通过决议案则需要支持票占总票数的60%%以上。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]单一货币[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]全球实行单一货币，这能大大促进贸易和商业发展。全世界每座城市额外增加一条商路。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]自由贸易[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]全球实行自由贸易，移除所有贸易壁垒。对商路的增加效果相当于所有文明均相互签署开放边界条约。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]禁止核武器[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]通过此项决议将禁止核武器扩散。所有文明均不得制造核武器（但现有核武器不会消失）。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]普选制度[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]通过此项决议将使所有文明实行[LINK=CIVIC_UNIVERSAL_SUFFRAGE]普选制度[\LINK]，不论其是否拥有相应科技。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]言论自由[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]通过此项决议将使所有文明实行[LINK=CIVIC_FREE_SPEECH]言论自由[\LINK]，不论其是否拥有相应科技。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]人身自由[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]通过此项决议将使所有文明实行[LINK=CIVIC_EMANCIPATION]人身自由[\LINK]，不论其是否拥有相应科技。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]绿色经济[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]通过此项决议将使所有文明实行[LINK=CIVIC_ENVIRONMENTALISM]绿色经济[\LINK]，不论其是否拥有相应科技。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]信仰自由[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]通过此项决议将使所有文明实行[LINK=CIVIC_FREE_RELIGION]信仰自由[\LINK]，不论其是否拥有相应科技。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]外交胜利[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]秘书长可以发起全球领袖选举以触发外交胜利。如果获得足够票数，即可成为无可争议的世界领袖并赢得游戏。谁说好人没好报?[PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: [H1]Units[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]In Civilization IV, the term "unit" refers to anything that can move around the map. There are a number of different types of units in play - military units, work units, missionaries and great people - with military units forming the bulk of them.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Unit Statistics[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]All units have two basic statistics (or "stats"): movement speed and combat strength.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Movement Speed[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]A unit's movement speed determines how quickly the unit can move around the map. Movement speeds generally range from 1 to 8. Some units have movement speeds of 0, which indicates that these units have special rules governing their movement. See the section on [LINK=CONCEPT_MOVEMENT]Movement[\LINK] for details.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Combat Strength[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]A unit's combat strength determines how tough the unit is when fighting an enemy unit. Combat strengths range from 1 to 40, and this base strength can be affected by many modifiers (see [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Combat[\LINK]). Some units have combat strengths of 0, which indicates that the unit cannot fight or has special rules governing combat. See the section on [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Combat[\LINK] for more details.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Acquiring Units[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]You can obtain units in a number of ways:[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Game Start[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]You have two or more units at the start of a game. At least one of these units is a settler; the remainder are workers or military units.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Tribal Villages[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]You may gain a new unit when one of your units enters a tribal village. (Or you may gain gold, technology, or experience - or the village may be hostile and generate barbarians to attack your unit.)[PARAGRAPH:2] [BOLD]Capturing Units[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2][LINK=UNIT_WORKER]Workers[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_SETTLER]Settlers[\LINK] are automatically captured when attacked by a military unit, or when they are in a city that is captured. (Note that settler units turn into workers when captured.)[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Constructing Units in Cities[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]You construct most of your units in [LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]Cities[\LINK]. See below.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Generating Units in Cities[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Your cities generate [LINK=CONCEPT_GREAT_PEOPLE]Great People[\LINK] units automatically. See that section for more details.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Gifts from other Civilizations[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Very rarely, a civilization may give you a unit.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Constructing Units in Cities[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]As discussed above, most of your units come from your cities. Cities also construct buildings (plus other specialized items). They can only construct one item at a time - balancing the need for units against the need for buildings is crucial to your success in the game. Following is some information about constructing units; more can be found in the [LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]Cities[\LINK] entry.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Choosing Units to Construct[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]When a city is ready to begin constructing a new unit or building, the city construction menu appears. This lists everything that you can construct in that city, as well as the time required for construction. Click on the unit/building you wish to build and the city will begin construction immediately. If you wish to change what a city is constructing, go to the city screen and click on the new item you wish to build.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Unit Availability[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Not all units are available for construction at the start of the game. Many units have [LINK=CONCEPT_TECHNOLOGY]Technological[\LINK] requirements, and some units require that you have access to one or more [LINK=CONCEPT_RESOURCES]Resources[\LINK]; for example, you cannot build a [LINK=UNIT_SWORDSMAN]Swordsman[\LINK] until you have researched [LINK=TECH_IRON_WORKING]Iron Working[\LINK] and have access to [LINK=BONUS_IRON]Iron[\LINK]. Also, a few units have [LINK=CONCEPT_BUILDINGS]Building[\LINK] and/or [LINK=CONCEPT_RELIGION]Religious[\LINK] prerequisites.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Construction Time[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]A unit's construction time is based upon the city's [LINK=CONCEPT_PRODUCTION]Production[\LINK]. The greater the amount of production a city has, the faster it can train new units.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Unit Support Costs[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]The number of free units you will be able to have is affected by the Difficulty Level you are playing. Once you have surpassed the number of free units you are awarded, you will be charged per unit over your free unit total. Each unit costs one gold per turn to maintain. Certain [LINK=CONCEPT_CIVICS]Civics[\LINK] modify the number number of free units that are available to you.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Unit Away Costs[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Units that are not within your civilizations borders cost additional money to maintain and supply. Invading an enemy civilization will cause a serious strain on your budget.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Selecting Units[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]A circle around a unit's indicates that the unit is "selected" and waiting for your orders. The computer auto-selects each unit waiting for orders in turn; if the unit already has orders the computer will not select that unit. You can also click on any of your units to select them manually.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Unit Orders[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]When a unit is selected, you can order it to move (see [LINK=CONCEPT_MOVEMENT]Movement[\LINK]), or to attack (see [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Combat[\LINK]). The unit might have other options available to it: these are displayed in the unit's "order box" at the middle-bottom of the screen. To give a unit an order, click on the appropriate icon in the order box (many orders have keyboard shortcuts, as well).[PARAGRAPH:2]There are a wide variety of orders available in Civilization IV. The specific orders available vary from unit to unit and may also vary depending upon the unit's location, health status, experience, and so forth. [PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Other Orders:[\BOLD] [LINK=UNIT_BOMBER]Bombers[\LINK] may have bombing orders; [LINK=UNIT_FIGHTER]Fighters[\LINK] may have recon orders; [LINK=UNIT_GALLEON]Galleons[\LINK] may have transport orders; and so forth. Check on a [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]Unit's[\LINK] Civilopedia entry to find out what a unit can do.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Selecting Multiple Units[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]You can select two or more units and give them both orders simultaneously. All of the units must be in the same space on the map. To do so, click on one unit, then shift-click on the other(s). All units will be selected.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Moving Multiple Units[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]If two or more units are selected and you give them orders to move, they will do so in a group, at the speed of the SLOWEST unit. (Note: it is often smart to move a settler and a military unit simultaneously to make sure that the settler doesn't get destroyed by the first animal or barbarian it runs into.)[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Multiple Unit Combat[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]If you have the stack attack option enabled and you order two or more military units to attack an enemy unit, the most powerful unit against the defender will attack that unit. If that unit's attack is unsuccessful, the attack won't continue automatically; if you want to attack with another unit, you'll have to give that unit new orders. However, if you hold down the ALT key when ordering an attack with multiple units selected, the units will perform a stack attack with combat resolving immediately.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Multiple Unit Improvements[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]If you have two or more workers selected, you can order them both to work on improvements. The workers' combined efforts will speed up construction considerably.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Promotions[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]A combat unit gets "experience points" for winning battles. Enough experience points will earn that unit [LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]promotions[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Unit Types[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Each unit belongs to a different "group"; for example, [LINK=UNIT_MUSKETMAN]Muskets[\LINK] are Gunpowder units and [LINK=UNIT_KNIGHT]Knights[\LINK] are considered Mounted units. Many of the promotions and natural unit abilities are based upon these unit types. For example, [LINK=UNIT_SPEARMAN]Spearmen[\LINK] naturally get a huge boost when fighting Mounted units, and the [LINK=PROMOTION_SHOCK]Shock[\LINK] promotion grants a unit +25%% against Melee units. Consult the entries on [LINK=PEDIA_MAIN_PROMOTION]Promotions[\LINK] and on each individual unit for more information.[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]单位[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]在文明IV中，“单位”指任何可以在地图上移动的对象。游戏中有多种类型的单位——军事单位，工人单位，传教士以及历史伟人——其中军事单位的种类占据了其中的大部分。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]单位数据[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]所有单位拥有两个基本信息数据（或叫“数值”）：移动速度和战斗能力。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]移动速度[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]单位的移动速度决定单位在地图上移动的快慢。移动速度通常在1到8之间。有的单位移动速度为0，表明此类单位有特殊的移动规则。详情见[LINK=CONCEPT_MOVEMENT]移动[\LINK]一节。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]战斗能力[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]单位的战斗能力决定单位与敌人作战时的表现。战斗能力通常在1到40之间，这个基础值可受许多修正因素的影响（见[LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]战斗[\LINK]）。有的单位战斗能力为0，表明此类单位无法用于作战，或有特殊的作战规则。详情见[LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]战斗[\LINK]一节。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]获得单位[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]要获得单位有多种方式:[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]游戏初始[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]游戏初始时你会拥有两个或更多的单位。其中至少会有一个移民单位；其余的可能是工人或军事单位。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]部落村庄[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]当你的单位进入一个部落村庄时，可能获得一个新单位。（也可能获得金钱，科技或经验值——也可能该村庄决意与你为敌，派出蛮族单位向你进攻.）[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]俘获单位[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2][LINK=UNIT_WORKER]工人[\LINK]和[LINK=UNIT_SETTLER]移民[\LINK]在遭受军事单位攻击或是所在城市被占领，将被俘获。（注意移民被俘获后将转化为工人.）[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]在城市中组建单位[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]你的大多数单位均在[LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]城市[\LINK]中组建。见下文。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]在城市中产生单位[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]你的城市可以自动产生[LINK=CONCEPT_GREAT_PEOPLE]历史伟人[\LINK]单位。详细见相关小节。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]其他文明的赠礼[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]有时，某个文明可能向你赠送单位。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]在城市中组建单位[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]如上所述，你的大多数单位均在城市中组建。城市还能建造建筑（以及其他特殊项目）。一座城市同时只能进行一个项目——平衡处理单位项目和建筑项目之间的关系将是游戏胜利的关键。以下是组建单位的相关信息；更多信息见[LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]城市[\LINK]词条。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]选择所组建的单位[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]当城市准备开始一个新的建造项目时，将显示城市建造菜单。列出该城市可以建造的所有项目，以及完成每个项目所需的时间。点击其中一个单位/建筑，将立即开始建造。如果你希望改变城市的当前建造项目，可进入城市界面，点击希望建造的新项目。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]可选单位[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]游戏开始时可建造的单位非常有限。许多单位都有相应的[LINK=CONCEPT_TECHNOLOGY]科技[\LINK]前提，有些单位还需要拥有一种或更多种[LINK=CONCEPT_RESOURCES]资源[\LINK]；例如，要想组建[LINK=UNIT_SWORDSMAN]剑士[\LINK]你需要获得[LINK=TECH_IRON_WORKING]铁器[\LINK]科技并拥有[LINK=BONUS_IRON]铁[\LINK]资源。而且，有的单位还有[LINK=CONCEPT_BUILDINGS]建筑[\LINK]和/或[LINK=CONCEPT_RELIGION]宗教[\LINK]前提。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]建造时间[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]单位的建造时间基于城市的[LINK=CONCEPT_PRODUCTION]生产能力[\LINK]。城市拥有的工业产能越高，组建新单位的速度越快。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]单位维持费用[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]你可以拥有的免维持费用的单位数量受游戏难度的影响。一旦超过免维持费单位数量上限，超过数量的单位就需要支付维持费用。某些[LINK=CONCEPT_CIVICS]内政法令[\LINK]可改变免维持费单位数量上限。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]远征单位费用[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]处在本文明边界范围之外的单位需要额外支付补给费用。入侵敌国将造成大量的金钱耗费。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]选择单位[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]单位周围的圆环表示该单位被“选定”并等待你的命令。电脑会按顺序自动选择各个单位等待命令；如单位正在执行命令则电脑不会自动选择该单位。你也可以点击某个单位以进行手动选择。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]单位命令[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]单位被选定后，你可以命令其移动（见[LINK=CONCEPT_MOVEMENT]移动[\LINK]），或攻击（见[LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]战斗[\LINK]）。单位可能还有其他可选命令：这些命令将显示在屏幕下方中间的单位“命令清单”之中。要向单位下达命令，可点击命令清单中的相应命令（许多命令也有相应快捷键）。[PARAGRAPH:2]文明IV中有各种不同的单位命令。具体可选命令因单位种类不同而不同，还可能因单位的位置，实力状态，经验等等而不同。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]其他命令:[\BOLD][LINK=UNIT_BOMBER]轰炸机[\LINK]具有轰炸命令；[LINK=UNIT_FIGHTER]战斗机[\LINK]具有侦察命令；[LINK=UNIT_GALLEON]大帆船[\LINK]拥有运输命令等等。相关详情见文明百科的[LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]单位[\LINK]一节。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]选择多个单位[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]你可以选择两个以上的单位同时下达命令。所有单位必须位于同一区域。具体方法是，先点击一个单位，再按住Shift键点击其他单位。即可选定所有单位。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]移动多个单位[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]如果向两个以上被选定单位下达移动命令，他们将作为一个群组进行移动，速度以最慢的单位为准。（注意：同时移动一个移民和一个军事单位是聪明的做法，可确保移民不受野兽或蛮族的攻击.）[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]多个单位的作战[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]如果在启用了堆叠攻击选项的情况下向两个以上被选定单位下达攻击命令，对敌方攻击力最强的单位将首先进攻。如果该单位的攻击失败，将自动停止后续攻击；如果你希望其他单位继续攻击，必须重新下达命令。但是，如果你按住ALT键向多个单位下达攻击命令，所有单位将进行连续攻击，并立即判断最终战斗结果。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]多个单位修建设施[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]如果你选定两个以上的工人，可以命令其一起修建设施。多个工人共同修建设施将更快地完成项目。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]晋升[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]作战单位赢得战斗后将获得“经验点数”。经验点数可使单位获得[LINK=CONCEPT_PROMOTIONS]晋升[\LINK]。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]单位类型[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]每个单位都有所属的“类型群组”；例如，[LINK=UNIT_MUSKETMAN]火枪手[\LINK]属于火器单位[LINK=UNIT_KNIGHT]骑士[\LINK]属于骑乘单位。单位的晋升类型和特殊能力受所属类型的影响。例如，[LINK=UNIT_SPEARMAN]矛兵[\LINK]天生对骑乘单位具有极大的战斗力加成，而[LINK=PROMOTION_SHOCK]冲击能力[\LINK]晋升将使单位增加+25%%对肉搏单位的战斗力加成。具体详情见[LINK=PEDIA_MAIN_PROMOTION]晋升[\LINK]一节。[PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: [H1]Victory [\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]There are multiple paths to victory in Civilization IV. You can win by achieving political, cultural or technological dominance, and of course, by the ever-popular "crushing everyone else into dust beneath the wheels of your chariot" method. These various methods are described below:[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Effects of Victory[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]You win. Everybody else loses. Game over (but see below). If your victory was spectacular enough, your exploits might be recorded on the Civilization IV Hall of Fame screen.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Continuing a Game After Victory:[\BOLD] You can continue playing after winning the game, but any further accomplishments will not be recorded on the Hall of Fame screen. It is also impossible to win another victory type after victory or defeat has initially taken place.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Defeat[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]If you are wiped off the map or if one of your opponents achieves one of the victories listed below, you lose.
