The game is over. All of the other leaders will mock you. It's time to start a new game and try again.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Victory Conditions[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Following is a list of the ways you can achieve victory in Civilization IV. For more details, press F8 to go to the "Victory Conditions" screen. There you will see a list of the roads to victory available in the present game and how close you are to achieving each of them. (Note that if a specific type of victory is not listed on the Victory Conditions screen, it means that this particular victory was excluded during game setup.)[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Time Victory[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]The game ends at a specific turn, usually 2050 AD. The civilization with the highest score at the end of that turn wins.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Conquest Victory[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]The game ends when one civilization eliminates all rivals. A civilization is eliminated when its last city is captured or destroyed - even if it still has units in play.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Domination Victory[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]The game ends when one civilization controls 75%% of the world population AND 75%% of the world's land area.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Cultural Victory[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]The game ends when a civilization has three cities with "Legendary Culture" (50,000 culture points per city with Normal game speed). See [LINK=CONCEPT_CULTURE]Culture[\LINK] for a description of culture and how cities get it.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Space Race[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]The game ends when you construct all of the components for your space ship, launch it and successfully reach Alpha Centauri. You can keep track of the space race with rival civs by monitoring the F8 Victory Conditions screen. This screen lists all of the components needed to build the spaceship and how many you have completed so far.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Diplomatic Victory[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]The game ends when the [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITED_NATIONS]United Nations[\LINK] is built and a leader wins an election for world leader.[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]胜利[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]文明IV中要赢得胜利有多种方式。你可以通过取得政治，文化或科技方面的支配地位而获胜，当然，也可以通过广受玩家欢迎的“用战车把所有对手都辗至渣”而获胜。各种胜利方式说明如下:[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]胜利的结果[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]结果就是你赢了。其他人输了。游戏结束了（例外情况见下文）。如果你赢得足够精彩，你的成就将列入文明IV的名人殿堂。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]胜利之后继续游戏:[\BOLD]你在胜利之后仍可继续游戏，但此后的成绩不会记入名人殿堂。也不可能在此之后达到另一种胜利方式。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]失败[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]如果你被从地球上抹去，或是你的对手达到了某一项胜利方式，结果就是你输了。游戏结束了。所有其他领袖会嘲笑你。你应该新建游戏再试一次。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]胜利条件[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]以下是文明IV中所有胜利方式清单。具体详情可按F8键查看“胜利条件”界面。其中将显示当前游戏可用的胜利方式及进展程度。（注意如果某种胜利方式未在胜利条件界面中显示，说明此种胜利方式在游戏设置中被排除.）[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]时间胜利[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]游戏在达到特定回合时结束，通常为公元2050年。在回合结束时积分最高的文明获胜。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]征服胜利[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]游戏在某个文明消灭所有对手时结束。文明的灭亡是指其所有城市被占领或摧毁——即使仍有单位存在。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]支配胜利[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]游戏在某个文明控制世界人口的75%%以及世界陆地面积的75%%时结束。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]文化胜利[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]游戏在某个文明有三座城市的文化达到“辉煌永恒”级别时结束（正常游戏速度下每座城市应达到50,000文化点数）。有关文化的详情见[LINK=CONCEPT_CULTURE]文化[\LINK]一节。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]太空胜利[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]游戏在某个文明建成所有太空飞船组件并成功发射前往半人马座阿尔法星时结束。你可以按F8进入胜利条件界面，了解对手的太空飞船建设进度。胜利条件界面将显示所有需要建造的组件及当前完成情况。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]外交胜利[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]游戏在[LINK=CONCEPT_UNITED_NATIONS]联合国[\LINK]建成后某个文明赢得选举成为世界领袖时结束。[PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: [H1]War[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]War happens to everybody. Sooner or later even the most peace-loving leader is going to find himself fighting one of his neighbors - perhaps because all of the neutral lands have been taken, perhaps because his opponent controls resources he covets, or perhaps merely because he looked at him funny. You do not need to conquer the world to [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]Win[\LINK] a game of Civilization IV, but you do need to be able to defend yourself against other civilizations until you do win.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]How Wars Begin[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]There are a number of ways that a civilization may initiate war against another:[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Declare War[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]You can declare war on another civilization while conducting [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomacy[\LINK] with that civilization's leader.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Attack a Unit[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]When your unit enters a space containing a foreign unit, the program will ask if you want to attack that unit or enter peacefully. If you choose the former option, your unit and the other unit will battle, and your civs will be at war. If you choose the latter option, your unit will enter the other unit's square peacefully, and no war will ensue.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Enter Another Civilization's Territory without Signing Open Borders[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]When you direct a unit to enter another civilization's territory, the program will remind you that doing so will cause war with the other civilization. If you tell the unit to go ahead, the unit moves and you're at war.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Exceptions:[\BOLD] There are a couple of exceptions to this rule. If you have an [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Open Borders[\LINK] agreement with the civilization, then no war ensues. [LINK=UNIT_CARAVEL]Caravels[\LINK] and some "invisible" [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]Units[\LINK] do not cause war when entering another civilization's territory.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Have a Defensive Pact with a Civilization that is Attacked[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]If you have a [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Defensive Pact[\LINK] with another civilization and that civilization is attacked, you are automatically at war with the attacker. (Note that if your ally declares war on another civilization, your defensive alliance is revoked; you are not automatically at war with your ex-ally's new foe.)[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Have a Permanent Alliance with a Civilization that is Attacked or Attacks another Civilization[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]If you have a [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Permanent Alliance[\LINK] with another civilization, you are automatically at war with any civilization at war with your partner, no matter who started it.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Effects of War[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Units Expelled from Enemy Territory[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]If you had any visible units in your new enemy's territory when war was declared, all such units are expelled to your territory or neutral territory. The same happens to any of your enemy's units within your borders. (Note: This stops the shabby trick of making an Open Borders agreement with somebody, moving a lot of troops next to that civilization's capital, and then declaring war and assaulting the target city... Shame on you for even thinking of it!)[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Trade Agreements[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]If you have any trade agreements with your new enemy, all such agreements are now void. If your enemy's territory sits aside a trade network with a third civilization, that trade network is cut and you can no longer trade resources with the third civilization until a path is opened.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Movement Through Enemy Territory Slowed[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]If you have an Open Borders agreement with a civilization, your units can use that civilization's roads. If you are at war with another civilization, however, you cannot use the roads in that civilization's borders.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]War Weariness[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Your cities may become afflicted with [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR_WEARINESS]War Weariness[\LINK], which causes their population to become unhappy.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Combat[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]Combat will occur any time that one of your units tries to enter an enemy unit's square, and vice versa. See [LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]Combat[\LINK] for details.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Achieving Peace[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]War ends when one civilization loses all of its cities and is thus out of the game (see [LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]Victory[\LINK]). Short of total destruction, wars may be ended [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomatically[\LINK] when both sides agree to a Cease Fire or Peace Treaty.[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]战争[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]战争会临到任何国家头上。甚至最爱好和平的领袖也迟早会和邻国交战——也许因为所有土地已划分完毕，也许因为对方控制了他所垂涎的资源，或者只是因为对方的看人的眼神太讨厌。在文明IV中你不一定要通过征服世界赢得[LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]胜利[\LINK]，但在赢得胜利之前，你必须有能够保护自己不受其他文明的攻击。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]战争的开始[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]文明之间的战争可能有多种触发方式:[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]宣战[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]你可以在进行[LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]外交[\LINK]时向其他文明领袖宣战。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]攻击对方单位[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]当你的单位进入别国单位占据的区域，程序将询问你是要攻击该单位还是和平进入。如果你选择前者，双方单位将发生战斗，战争就此开始。如果你选择后者，你的单位可进入该区域而不引发战争。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]未签订开放边界条约而进入别国领土[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]当你命令一个单位进入其他文明的领土，程序将提醒你这样做将导致与该国的战争。如果你坚持命令单位前进，战争即爆发。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]例外:[\BOLD]上述情况存在例外。如果你与对方文明签有[LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]开放边界[\LINK]条约，则不会引发战争。[LINK=UNIT_CARAVEL]轻帆船[\LINK]以及某些“隐形”[LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]单位[\LINK]在进入别国领土时不会引发战争。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]与遭受攻击的文明签有共同防御条约[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]如果你与某个文明签有[LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]共同防御[\LINK]条约，当该国遭受攻击时，你将与攻击方进入战争状态。（注意如果是你的盟友主动对其他文明宣战，共同防御条约即告失效；你将不会加入这场战争.）[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]签有永久性同盟条约的文明遭受攻击或攻击其他文明[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]如果你与其他文明签有[LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]永久性同盟[\LINK]条约，你将自动与任何同盟友交战的国家进入战争状态，不论哪一方主动开战。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]战争的影响[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]单位被驱出敌方领土[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]如果你在开战时有任何非隐形单位在敌方领土之内，这些单位将自动回到本国领土或中立区域。敌方在你境内的单位亦然。（注意：这将防止利用开放边界条约调集大军进入其他文明的领土，然后不宣而战夺取其首都的做法……这种做法是很可耻的!）[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]贸易协议[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]如果你原来与新的敌人签订有贸易协议，此类协议将自动失效。如果你与第三方的贸易网络需要通过敌方的领土，该贸易线路也将中断。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]在敌方领土的移动速度[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]如果你与其他文明签有开放边界条约，你的单位将可利用该国的道路。如果你与该国开战，你将无法利用该国境内的道路。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]厌战情绪[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]你的城市可能出现[LINK=CONCEPT_WAR_WEARINESS]厌战情绪[\LINK]，造成城市居民的不满。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]战斗[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:2]你的单位试图进入敌方单位所在区域，或敌方单位试图进入你的单位所在区域都将引发战斗。详情见[LINK=CONCEPT_COMBAT]战斗[\LINK]一节。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]实现和平[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]如果一方文明因失去所有城市而被消失，战争即结束（见[LINK=CONCEPT_VICTORY]胜利[\LINK]）。除此之外，战争也可能通过[LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]外交方式[\LINK]结束，如果双方同意签订停火协议或和平协议。[PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: [H1]War Weariness[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]If you are engaged in a protracted [LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]War[\LINK], then "war weariness" may begin to make your citizens unhappy. The section on [LINK=CONCEPT_HAPPINESS]Happiness[\LINK] discusses in depth the effects of unhappiness and how to deal with it, but here are some special rules about war weariness.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Captured Cities[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]If you have captured a city from another civilization, the captured city is much more susceptible to war weariness while you're fighting that civilization. This effect fades over time as you fully assimilate the city into your culture.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Fighting War Weariness[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]There are a number of ways to limit the effects of war weariness. The most obvious way is to make peace; that stops the unhappiness immediately. If that is not feasible, then you can build [LINK=BUILDING_JAIL]Jails[\LINK] to reduce war weariness or adopt the [LINK=CIVIC_POLICE_STATE]Police State[\LINK] civic to completely eliminate war weariness. You can also devote a greater percentage of your civilization's commerce to the [LINK=CONCEPT_CULTURE]Culture Button[\LINK] (enabled with the [LINK=TECH_DRAMA]Drama[\LINK] technology) to help increase the happiness of your citizens.[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]厌战情绪[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]如果你卷入一场长期的[LINK=CONCEPT_WAR]战争[\LINK]，则“厌战情绪”可能导致你的市民不满。在[LINK=CONCEPT_HAPPINESS]快乐[\LINK]一节详细说明了不满的影响和解决方法，但关于厌战情绪还有一些特别的规定。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]被占领城市[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]如果你从其他文明手中占领了一座城市，被占领城市将因你与其原属文明进行的战争而表现出极度的厌战情绪。这种影响会随时间的流逝和文明的同化而逐渐消失。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]消除厌战情绪[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]要消除厌战情绪的影响有多种方法。最直接的方法就是实现和平；这将立即消除厌战情绪。如果无法做到，则可以建造[LINK=BUILDING_JAIL]监狱[\LINK]以降低厌战情绪，或实施[LINK=CIVIC_POLICE_STATE]强化监控[\LINK]内政法令以完全消除厌战情绪。你还可以将更大比例的金钱分配到[LINK=CONCEPT_CULTURE]文化支出[\LINK]（需要[LINK=TECH_DRAMA]戏剧[\LINK]科技）以提升市民的快乐度。[PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: [H1]Wealth[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Time and again, history shows us the importance of managing wealth properly. In the 16th century, Spain had access to the nearly limitless gold and silver of Central and South America, yet so much of this wealth was lost through corruption and mismanagement that Spain was unable to finance the ships and soldiers to protect her American possessions, leaving them vulnerable to attack by enemy nations and pirates. At the end of the First World War, Germany was bankrupt and shorn of her overseas colonies; yet in twenty years she acquired enough wealth to build and support the mightiest military machine yet seen in the world.[PARAGRAPH:2]Wealth is an extremely important part of Civilization IV; manage your wealth properly and your civilization will flourish and thrive; squander it and your civilization will languish.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2] Current Wealth[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]The "wealth counter" on the main screen displays your current wealth. This is usually a positive number or zero (if it is not, your civilization is in serious trouble!). The number adjacent to the wealth counter shows how much wealth your civilization is currently gaining (or losing) each turn.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Commerce and Wealth[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]The amount of wealth that your cities are producing is determined by what percentage of your commerce is going into [LINK=CONCEPT_RESEARCH]Research[\LINK] (and, later on, [LINK=CONCEPT_CULTURE]Culture[\LINK]). The percentage of your commerce that is turned into wealth is whatever is not being spent on research and culture. For example, if you are spending 70%% on science and 10%% on culture, the remaining 20%% of your commerce is going towards generating wealth.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Acquiring Wealth[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]City Wealth:[\BOLD] Each of your cities generates commerce from working the spaces within its [LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]City Radius,[\LINK] and certain [LINK=CONCEPT_RESOURCES]Resources[\LINK] such as gold, silver, and incense are particularly valuable. Constructing [LINK=CONCEPT_IMPROVEMENTS]Improvements[\LINK] such as cottages and mines can dramatically increase the commerce of your cities - which will translate into more wealth.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Tribal Villages:[\BOLD] When one of your units enters a "tribal village," the villagers might give you gold as tribute.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Capturing Cities and Plundering Improvements:[\BOLD] You may gain an influx of gold when you capture an enemy or barbarian city. You may get a (far smaller) portion of gold when your units [LINK=CONCEPT_IMPROVEMENTS]Pillage[\LINK] enemy/barbarian improvements.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Great Merchants:[\BOLD] If your cities generate a [LINK=UNIT_MERCHANT]Great Merchant[\LINK], you can send him on a Trade Mission to a foreign city. This will generate an enormous amount of gold that gets placed in your civilization's treasury.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Diplomacy:[\BOLD] You can acquire wealth through [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomacy[\LINK] through the buying and selling of technologies and the trading of resources. [PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Expending Wealth[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]City Maintenance:[\BOLD] It costs a certain amount each turn to maintain your cities. This cost increases as the size and number of your cities increase. A city's distance from the [LINK=BUILDING_PALACE]Palace[\LINK] also affects its maintenance cost.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Civic Upkeep:[\BOLD] Most [LINK=CONCEPT_CIVICS]Civics[\LINK] have upkeep costs associated with them that cost a certain amount of gold each turn. Some civics are much more expensive than others, so keep this in mind when selecting civics.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Inflation:[\BOLD] As a game of Civilization IV progresses, your empire will slowly become more expensive to maintain due to the economic process known as Inflation. This will cost your civilization a certain amount of gold each turn in addition to all other costs. You cannot fight Inflation, other than by generating more wealth to counteract its effects.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Technological Research:[\BOLD] You spend money each turn to finance your civilization's [LINK=CONCEPT_RESEARCH]Technological Research[\LINK]; at some point, it will almost certainly be necessary to scale back research to prevent your civilization from going bankrupt.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Unit Support:[\BOLD] Depending upon your current civics, you may be required to pay "support costs" for each [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]Unit[\LINK] you have in play.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Unit Upgrades:[\BOLD] After you have built a unit, future [LINK=CONCEPT_TECHNOLOGY]Technological Advances[\LINK] may allow you to upgrade that unit (say, from an archer to a crossbowman). You must pay for such upgrades.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Hurrying Construction: [\BOLD]The [LINK=CIVIC_UNIVERSAL_SUFFRAGE]Universal Suffrage[\LINK] civic allows you to spend gold to "hurry" a city's construction of units or buildings.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Diplomacy:[\BOLD] You can expend wealth to grease the wheels of [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Diplomacy[\LINK] in many different ways. Enemy civilizations will usually agree to do what you want - if the price is right.[PARAGRAPH:2]You can see a display of all of your civilization's current expenditures by opening up the Financial Advisor screen with the F3 key.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Civics and Wealth[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Your civilization's [LINK=CONCEPT_CIVICS]Civics[\LINK] greatly affect the rate at which you acquire/expend wealth. For example, some civics reward you for peaceful trading, while others cut down the cost of maintaining a huge army.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Running Out of Money[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]If your civilization cannot afford to pay its current expenses, your cities will go on "strike;" they will cease production of units and buildings until your finances are in better shape. Further, you may lose units and buildings that you cannot afford to pay support for. When your cities go on strike, it is extremely important to get expenses in line with income as soon as possible.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Early Wealth Mismanagement[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]It is quite possible to get yourself into serious financial difficulties in the early game. This usually occurs because you have built too many cities or units without first constructing the buildings and improvements necessary for your existing cities to support the costs of this expansion. The result is that your expenses greatly outstrip your income and your treasury goes away fast. There are a number of possible steps you can take to get out of this fiscal mess:[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Tribal Villages:[\BOLD] If there are any tribal villages about, send a unit to them; they may give you wealth as tribute. (This is a stop-gap solution at best!)[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Lower Your Research Budget:[\BOLD] Decrease the amount you are spending each turn on [LINK=CONCEPT_RESEARCH]Technological Research[\LINK] using the button in the top-left corner of the screen.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Build Improvements:[\BOLD] Build [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_COTTAGE]Cottages[\LINK] and other [LINK=CONCEPT_IMPROVEMENTS]Improvements[\LINK] that exploit money-making resources within your [LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]Borders[\LINK]: mines for gold and silver, camps for fur and ivory, and so forth. Build roads to connect your cities to these resources.[PARAGRAPH:2] [BOLD]Construct Buildings:[\BOLD] Build [LINK=BUILDING_COURTHOUSE]Courthouses[\LINK] to reduce your city maintenance costs and [LINK=BUILDING_MARKET]Markets[\LINK] to increase your income. If you aren't able to construct those buildings yet, direct your [LINK=CONCEPT_RESEARCH]Research[\LINK] towards the techs which will allow their construction. Failing to construct these buildings soon enough is a problem that nearly every newcomer to Civilization IV encounters![PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Build Wealth:[\BOLD] If your tech level allows, you can assign your cities to build Wealth rather than new units or buildings.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Emphasize Wealth:[\BOLD] Set your cities to [LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]"Emphasize Wealth"[\LINK] when working the land around them. Be aware, however, that the city governor may not make the same choices that you would.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Adjust Civics:[\BOLD] Check the [LINK=CONCEPT_CIVICS]Civics[\LINK] screen to see if you can reduce your "civic upkeep" by switching to less expensive civics.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Destroy Units:[\BOLD] Delete extra military units. Destroy settlers rather then creating more cities that you cannot support.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Diplomacy:[\BOLD] Depending upon your present technology level, you may be able to get gold from your neighbors - through trade OR coercion.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Capture Enemy Cities:[\BOLD] You usually get some significant cash from capturing enemy cities or pillaging improvements.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Abandon Cities:[\BOLD] If nothing else works, you can abandon money-losing cities. You can give them to other civilizations via diplomacy, or you can simply remove all military units from a city and hope that a barbarian captures it. (If things are THIS bad, however, you might also want to consider the "Start a New Game" ploy.)[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]财富[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]历史的经验一再证明了良好的财政管理对国家的重要性。在16世纪，西班牙从中美和南美地区获得了几乎无法计数的金银，但如此巨额的财富却因贪污腐败和管理不善而大量流失，以至于西班牙政府无钱维持足够的舰船和军队以保护其在美洲的领地，成为一块敌国和海盗肆意掠夺的肥肉。在第一次世界大战结束时，德国已完全破产并被迫放弃所有海外殖民地；但仅仅过了二十年时间，便再次积累起充足的财富，能够组建并维持人类历史上最强大的战争机器。[PARAGRAPH:2]财富在文明IV中也极为重要；正确理财可使你的文明繁荣兴旺；浪费财富则会使你的文明走向衰败。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]现有财富[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]主界面中的“财富计数器”显示了你现有的财富。现有财富通常为正数或零（如果为负数，将非常糟糕!）。现有财富后的数值显示你的文明在每回合增加（或减少）的金钱数量。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]商业收入与财富[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]你的城市所创造的财富由你的商业收入投入[LINK=CONCEPT_RESEARCH]科研[\LINK]（以及稍后的[LINK=CONCEPT_CULTURE]文化[\LINK]）的比例所决定。所有商业收入扣除投入科研和文化事业的部分即转化为财富。例如，如果你将商业收入的70%%投入科技，10%%投入文化，则剩余的20%%将转为现金财富。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]获取财富[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]城市财富:[\BOLD]你的城市通过安排市民在[LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]城市范围[\LINK]区域内工作来创造商业收入。某些[LINK=CONCEPT_RESOURCES]资源[\LINK]例如黄金，白银，和薰香具有极高的商业价值。修建[LINK=CONCEPT_IMPROVEMENTS]区域设施[\LINK]例如农舍与矿井可以大大提升城市的商业收入——从而带来更多的财富。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]部落村庄:[\BOLD]当你的单位进入“部落村庄,”村民可能向你提供金钱赠礼。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]占领城市及劫掠设施:[\BOLD]在你占领敌国或蛮族城市时可能获得一笔金钱。在你的单位[LINK=CONCEPT_IMPROVEMENTS]劫掠[\LINK]敌国或蛮族区域设施时也可能获得（较少量的）金钱。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]大商业家:[\BOLD]如果你的城市产生了一位[LINK=UNIT_MERCHANT]大商业家[\LINK]，你可以将他派往外国城市开展贸易事业。这将为你的国库带来一大笔金钱。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]外交:[\BOLD]你可以通过[LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]外交[\LINK]交换科技和资源以获取财富。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]消耗财富[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]城市维护费:[\BOLD]你的城市在每回合都需要消耗维护费。维护费总额将随城市规模和数量的增加而上升。城市与[LINK=BUILDING_PALACE]宫殿[\LINK]的距离也会影响维护费的高低。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]内政经费:[\BOLD]大多数[LINK=CONCEPT_CIVICS]内政法令[\LINK]的实施也需要每回合支出相应费用。有些内政法令的经费水平很高，在选择内政法令时需加以注意。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]通货膨胀:[\BOLD]随着游戏的进行，维持文明发展所需的费用将随着通货膨胀这一经济现象而不断提升。通货膨胀会使你在每回合的正常支出以外还需消耗一笔金钱。你无法遏制通货膨胀，只能依靠创造更多的财富来抵销其影响。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]科技研究:[\BOLD]你需要每回合支出一笔经费用于[LINK=CONCEPT_RESEARCH]科技研究[\LINK]；在必要的情况下，你需要削减科研经费，以避免财政破产。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]单位维持费:[\BOLD]根据你当前所实施的内政法令，你可能需要为你的[LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]单位[\LINK]支付维持费。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]单位升级:[\BOLD]在你组建单位之后，获得新的[LINK=CONCEPT_TECHNOLOGY]科技进展[\LINK]可能允许你升级原有单位（例如将弓手升级为弩手）。升级单位通常也需要支出金钱。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]加速建造:[\BOLD]实行[LINK=CIVIC_UNIVERSAL_SUFFRAGE]普选制度[\LINK]内政法令可允许你支付金钱以“加速”城市单位或建筑工程的进度。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]外交:[\BOLD]你可以使用金钱作为[LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]外交[\LINK]手段。敌对的文明也可能满足你的要求——只要出得起价钱。[PARAGRAPH:2]你可以按F3键打开财政顾问界面，查看当前的财政状况。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]内政法令与财富[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]文明所实行的[LINK=CONCEPT_CIVICS]内政法令[\LINK]对财富的获取和消耗有重大影响。例如，有的内政法令可增进国际贸易收入，有的则可以降低维持大量军队的花费。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]财富耗尽[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]如果你的文明现有财富无法满足支出需要，你的城市将会“罢工;”停止单位和建筑工程，直到财政状况获得改善。此外，无力支付维持费还可能导致单位解散和建筑被毁。如果你的城市发生罢工，需要尽快设法改善财政状况。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]早期财政困难[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]在游戏早期你可能陷入严重的财政困难。这通常是由于你建造了过多的城市或单位，而没有建设能为扩张提供财政支持的建筑与设施。因支出远大于收入而耗尽现金储备。解决此类问题有多种方法:[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]部落村庄:[\BOLD]如果发现部落村庄，可派遣单位前往查探；村民可能向你提供金钱赠礼。（这至少能缓解燃眉之息!）[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]减少科研支出:[\BOLD]点击屏幕左上角的按钮减少每回合投入[LINK=CONCEPT_RESEARCH]科技研究[\LINK]的经费比例。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]修建设施:[\BOLD]修建[LINK=IMPROVEMENT_COTTAGE]农舍[\LINK]及其他[LINK=CONCEPT_IMPROVEMENTS]区域设施[\LINK]获取[LINK=CONCEPT_BORDERS]国界[\LINK]以内的有价值资源：修建矿井获取黄金和白银，修建猎场获取毛皮和象牙等等。修建道路将这些资源连接到城市。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]建造建筑:[\BOLD]建造[LINK=BUILDING_COURTHOUSE]法庭[\LINK]减少城市的维护费，建造[LINK=BUILDING_MARKET]市场[\LINK]增加收入。如果还不能建造此类建筑，则尽快[LINK=CONCEPT_RESEARCH]研究[\LINK]相应的科技。文明IV的新手的问题就是往往不能及时建造此类建筑![PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]生产财富:[\BOLD]如果获得相应科技，你可以命令城市将工业产能转为财富而不是建造单位和建筑。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]专注财富:[\BOLD]令城市周边设施的修建[LINK=CONCEPT_CITIES]“专注于财富”[\LINK]。但是要注意，电脑市长的具体选择可能与你的希望不符。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]调整内政法令:[\BOLD]打开[LINK=CONCEPT_CIVICS]内政法令[\LINK]界面查看是否可能通过选择低经费水平的内政制度以减少“内政经费”。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]解散单位:[\BOLD]解散多余的军事单位。解散已组建的移民单位，而不是继续建立无法维持的城市。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]外交:[\BOLD]根据当前科技水平，你可能从邻国获得金钱——通过交易或是敲诈。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]占领敌方城市:[\BOLD]你可以通过占领敌方城市或劫掠区域设施获得大量金钱。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]废弃城市:[\BOLD]如果其他办法没有效果，你可以废弃无用的城市。你可以通过外交将其赠送给其他文明，或撤出守城的军事单位，任由蛮族将其占领。（当然如果情况已无可挽回，你还可以考虑“开始新游戏”。）[PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: [H1]Wonders[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Wonders are the spectacular buildings, inventions, and concepts that have stood the test of time and changed the world forever. The Pyramids, Notre Dame Cathedral, the Statue of Liberty and Hollywood are all examples of wonders. Wonders require much time and energy from your cities, but once completed, they provide your civilization with many benefits.[PARAGRAPH:2]There are two basic types of wonders: great wonders and national wonders.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Great Wonders[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2] Great wonders are unique; only one of each can be constructed during a game. For example, the Great Lighthouse is a great wonder; whoever completes it first is the only one who may possess its benefits. Great Wonders tend to be quite powerful indeed, but also extremely time-consuming to build.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]National Wonders[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2] National wonders may be built once by each civilization in the game. That is, each civilization can have the Wall Street national wonder (though no civilization can have two of them). Each city may only build two national wonders, so be sure to plan ahead where you wish to put them. [PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Constructing Wonders[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2] Wonders are constructed in cities, like any other [LINK=CONCEPT_BUILDINGS]Building[\LINK]. If you can build a wonder, it will appear in your city build menu; just click on the wonder to get started. Note that only one city in your civilization can be building a single wonder at a time.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Losing the Construction Race:[\BOLD] If another civilization completes a great wonder while you are in the process of building it, your construction ceases, and a certain amount of your production efforts are converted into gold. This does not occur with national wonders, since each civilization can build its own copy of those.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Wonders and Resources:[\BOLD] Certain resources will allow cities to produce wonders of both types at double the usual speed. For example, a civilization that has Stone connected to its [LINK=CONCEPT_CITY_NETWORK]City Network[\LINK] can build the Pyramids at a much faster rate.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Civilization Traits:[\BOLD] [LINK=CONCEPT_LEADERS]Leaders[\LINK] who possess the Industrious trait build all wonders at twice the usual rate.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Effects of Wonders[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Wonders have a broad range of effects. Some increase productivity; others increase income from trade. Some improve research, others make your workers build improvements faster. All wonders improve their home city's [LINK=CONCEPT_CULTURE]Cultural Output[\LINK] as well as the speed at which the city generates [LINK=CONCEPT_GREAT_PEOPLE]Great People[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Capturing Wonders[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]If you capture a city with a great wonder, you gain possession of that wonder. If you capture a city with a national wonder, the national wonder is destroyed. If a city is destroyed, all wonders in that city are destroyed along with it. Great wonders can never be rebuilt once they are destroyed.[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]Wonder Obsolescence[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]Some wonders can become obsolete over time. This obsolescence is caused by any civilization in the game learning a specific technology. When that occurs, the wonder's special effects vanish, but it still continues to produce culture. For example, the Great Lighthouse wonder provides a trade benefit to all coastal cities, as well as +8 culture to the city where it is constructed. The Great Lighthouse is rendered obsolete once any civilization gains the [LINK=TECH_STEAM_POWER]Steam Power[\LINK] technology, at which point the owner loses the Lighthouse's trade benefit but retains its +8 cultural output.[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]奇观[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]奇观指那些历经时间考验，深刻影响世界历史的伟大建筑，发明创造或思想观念等。例如大金字塔，圣母院，自由女神像和好莱坞等等。建设奇观需要城市付出大量时间和精力，但如果能够完成，将为你的文明带来许多利益。[PARAGRAPH:2]奇观分为两类：世界奇观（大奇观）和国家奇观（小奇观）。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]世界奇观[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]大奇观是独一无二的；整个游戏中只能建造一个。例如，大灯塔即属于大奇观；最先完成大奇观的文明将独享其利益。大奇观的作用非常大，但其建造也需要付出非常多的时间。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]国家奇观[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]国家奇观每个文明均可在游戏中建造一个。例如，每个文明都可以拥有自己的华尔街（但不能拥有两个）。每个城市只能建造两座国家奇观，因此需要事先做好规划。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]建造奇观[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]奇观在城市中建造，和其他[LINK=CONCEPT_BUILDINGS]建筑[\LINK]一样。如果你可能建造某座奇观，它将出现在城市的建造菜单中；只需点击该奇观即开始建造。注意你的文明在同一时间只能有一座城市建造某一特定奇观。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]在建造竞争中失败:[\BOLD]如果其他文明先于你完成一座大奇观，你的建造进程将中断，已经积累的产能将转换为一定数量的金钱。但国家级奇观则不存在此种文明间竞争的问题。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]奇观和资源:[\BOLD]某些资源可使奇观建造速度加倍。例如，一个文明的[LINK=CONCEPT_CITY_NETWORK]城市网络[\LINK]中如果有花岗石，则可以更快速地建造大金字塔。[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]文明特质:[\BOLD][LINK=CONCEPT_LEADERS]文明领袖[\LINK]如果拥有勤奋刻苦的特质，则奇观建造速度加倍。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]奇观的作用[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]奇观拥有各种不同的作用。有些增加生产力；有些增加贸易收入。有些提升科研能力，还有的能使你的工人更有效率。所有奇观均能增加所在城市的[LINK=CONCEPT_CULTURE]文化产出[\LINK]以及城市产生[LINK=CONCEPT_GREAT_PEOPLE]历史伟人[\LINK]的几率。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]夺取奇观[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]如果你夺取了拥有大奇观的城市，也就拥有了该座大奇观。如果你夺取了拥有国家奇观的城市，该国家奇观会被摧毁。如果城市被摧毁，其中所有的奇观也会随之毁灭。大奇观被摧毁后无法再次重建。[PARAGRAPH:2][H2]奇观的过时[\H2][PARAGRAPH:2]有些奇观会随时间的流逝而失去作用。任何发明特定科技将使某些奇观过时。在这种情况下，奇观的特殊作用将消失，但是仍能继续积累文化值。例如，大灯塔能为所有海滨城市带来商业收入，并使所在城市文化产出+8。大灯塔的将在任何文明获得[LINK=TECH_STEAM_POWER]蒸汽机[\LINK]科技之后过时，该奇观将不再带来商业收入，但城市每回合文化产出则继续+8。[PARAGRAPH:2]
